analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi bas lus dang ngag dang yid kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang pha dang ma'am de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams la bsgrubs nas skye ba 'di'am srid pa gzhan rnams su sdig pa gang cung zad bgyis pa dang bgyid

translated: I, [name], from this day forward, until reaching the heart of awakening, go for refuge to all the Blessed Buddhas, the supreme humans, the compassionate ones, the omniscient ones, the teachers of all, who have gone beyond all enemies and fears, the great beings, whose bodies are indivisible, whose bodies are unsurpassed.

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi mchog zhi ba'i chos la skyabs su mchi'o //

translated: I, [name], for the sake of the infinite realms of sentient beings, in order to liberate them from the sufferings of samsara, in order to protect them, in order to thoroughly guard them, and in order to establish them all in the unsurpassed wisdom of omniscience, just as those bodhisattvas of the past, present, and future generated the mind of enlightenment

translated: and went to buddhahood, are going, and will go to buddhahood, and just as all buddhas, with their unobstructed buddha wisdom and buddha eye, know and see, and just as they know the dharmata of phenomena, I, [name], with that very ritual, generate the unsurpassed mind of enlightenment in the presence of all buddhas and bodhisattvas of the ten directions and three times.

original: 'di zhes bgyi ba slob dpon ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i mdun dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mdun du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bgyi'o //

translated: I, named so-and-so, in the presence of the teacher named so-and-so, and in the presence of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, arouse the Mind of Enlightenment.

original: de ltar lan gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar lan gsum mo //

original: bdag gis sdig pa bshags pa dang gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa las skyes pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ste /

original: skyob pa med pa skyabs med pa gnas med pa dpung gnyen med pa gling med pa'i 'jig rten du /
analyzed: skyob pa med pa skyabs med pa gnas med pa dpung gnyen med pa gling med pa'i 'jig rten du /
translated: In a world without a protector, without refuge, without support, without a friend, without an island,

analyzed: skyob pa dang skyabs dang gnas dang dpung gnyen dang gling du 'gyur bar bgyi'o //

analyzed: dbugs ma phyin pa rnams dbugs dbyung bar bgyi'o //

analyzed: 'di ltar lan gsum mo // bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba de ltar byang chub tu sems @76a * //

translated: I, [your name], having generated the mind of awakening in this way, will regard the infinite realms of sentient beings as if they were my mother, father, sister, brother, son, daughter, relatives, and blood relatives.

translated: From now on, whatever I give, whatever morality I guard, whatever patience I perfect, whatever effort I undertake, whatever meditative stabilization I enter,

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'o //

original: de ltar lan gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar lan gsum mo //
translated: In this way, three times.

translated: In this way, having previously dedicated the merit, and having taken hold of the beings, and having gathered the accumulations for the sake of protecting them, and having caused them to follow in accordance with the Great Vehicle,

analyzed: bdag gi mdun du /

analyzed: lung gi don ni kho bo cag gis rnam pa gzhan du yang nus pa'i phyir spros pas chog go //

original: 'o na sems can dang yan lag dang yul dang dus nges pa dang bcas pas yang dag par blangs pa sems can 'di las spang ngo //
analyzed: 'o na sems can dang yan lag dang yul dang dus nges pa dang bcas pas yang dag par blangs pa sems can 'di las spang ngo //
translated: If one takes the vow with a specific sentient being, limb, place, and time, such as, ‚ÄúI will abandon taking life from this sentient being,‚Äù

original: yan lag 'di dang yul 'di dang zla phyed dang zla ba'am yul la sogs pa'i dus las gzhan du'o zhes pa de cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag 'di dang yul 'di dang zla phyed dang zla ba'am yul la sogs pa'i dus las gzhan du'o zhes pa de cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: ‚Äúfrom this limb,‚Äù ‚Äúin this place,‚Äù ‚Äúfor half a month, a month, or a year,‚Äù and so on, what happens if one takes life from another sentient being, another limb, another place, or at another time?

original: legs par spyad pa tsam du 'gyur te rnam pa thams cad du sdig pa spong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa tsam du 'gyur te rnam pa thams cad du sdig pa spong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It becomes merely a good action, because it is not the abandonment of all forms of taking life.

original: de bzhin du sdom pa ma yin pa can rnams kyi de'i rigs can rnams bya ba la rab tu sbyor ba dang / gzhan rnams de'i las de khas blangs pa las mi dge ba rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyun yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par bya bar ngas pa'i mtshan nyid can sdom pa ma yin pa skye la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdom pa ma yin pa can rnams kyi de'i rigs can rnams bya ba la rab tu sbyor ba dang / gzhan rnams de'i las de khas blangs pa las mi dge ba rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyun yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par bya bar ngas pa'i mtshan nyid can sdom pa ma yin pa skye la /
translated: Similarly, for those who possess negative commitments, those who engage in the action of killing and so on generate negative commitments that are the opposite of the continuum of virtue that is the cause of nonvirtue.

original: gang zhig 'di rnams la rtag tu 'jug pa ste gang las thob pa yongs su smin pa las phyis phun sum tshogs pa min pa rnams skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di rnams la rtag tu 'jug pa ste gang las thob pa yongs su smin pa las phyis phun sum tshogs pa min pa rnams skye ba'o //
translated: Those who constantly engage in these actions, from the full ripening of what is obtained, later give rise to what is not perfect.

original: 'di la dus yongs su bcad pa ci yang med de yang dag par blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la dus yongs su bcad pa ci yang med de yang dag par blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fixed time for this, because it is not taken up.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa yang dag par len pa ni 'ga' yang med la bsam pa ngan pa can ni bya ba de dang mngon par 'brel pa las sdom pa ma yin pa so sor thob po //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa yang dag par len pa ni 'ga' yang med la bsam pa ngan pa can ni bya ba de dang mngon par 'brel pa las sdom pa ma yin pa so sor thob po //
translated: There is no one who takes up immorality, but one who has an evil intention obtains immorality through the connection with that action.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig yang dag par blangs par gyur pa nyid na de'i tshe sdom pa ltar dus nges pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig yang dag par blangs par gyur pa nyid na de'i tshe sdom pa ltar dus nges pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: If someone were to take it up, then at that time it would be for a definite period of time, just as is the case with morality.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa nyes par spyod pa de 'di rnams la yod pas sdom pa ma yin pa can rnams so //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa nyes par spyod pa de 'di rnams la yod pas sdom pa ma yin pa can rnams so //
translated: They are immoral because they have that immorality which is bad conduct.

original: de rnams kyang shan pa dang @79b bya gag pa dang phag pa dang nya pa dang bya dang ri dags rngon pa dang / rkun po dang gshed ma dang btson srung ba dang sprul 'ching ba dang glang po che 'dul ba dang khyi 'tshor  ba rnams dang rgyas 'tshor ba rnams dang rgyal po'i chad pa ba dang shags zan pa rnams ni don gyi sdom pa ma yin pa can no
analyzed: de rnams kyang shan pa dang @79b bya gag pa dang phag pa dang nya pa dang bya dang ri dags rngon pa dang / rkun po dang gshed ma dang btson srung ba dang sprul 'ching ba dang glang po che 'dul ba dang khyi 'tshor  ba rnams dang rgyas 'tshor ba rnams dang rgyal po'i chad pa ba dang shags zan pa rnams ni don gyi sdom pa ma yin pa can no
translated: Butchers, poultry killers, pig killers, fishermen, bird hunters, deer hunters, thieves, executioners, prison guards, snake charmers, elephant trainers, dog trainers, wrestlers, actors, and those who work for the king as punishment officers or as judges are not possessors of vows.

original: // de las gzhan pa rnams sdom pa can ma yin la sdom pa ma yin pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: // de las gzhan pa rnams sdom pa can ma yin la sdom pa ma yin pa can ma yin te /
translated: Others are neither possessors of vows nor possessors of negative commitments.

original: 'di rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ni sdom pa ma yin la sdom pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ni sdom pa ma yin la sdom pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Their virtuous and nonvirtuous actions are neither vows nor negative commitments.

original: de yang zhing dang bsam pa dang bya ba nges pa dang dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa dang 'bad pas 'jug pa las skye ste /
analyzed: de yang zhing dang bsam pa dang bya ba nges pa dang dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa dang 'bad pas 'jug pa las skye ste /
translated: They arise from the determination of field, intention, action, and substance, and from the exertion of engagement.

original: 'di rnams spangs pa las ldog go //
analyzed: 'di rnams spangs pa las ldog go //
translated: They are stopped by abandoning these.

original: de la zhing las ni dper na dkon mchog gsum gyi ched du gtsug lag khang bzhengs pa la sogs pa rdzas byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnams las bsod nams kyi phung po ji srid du 'di rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bar du nye bar skye
analyzed: de la zhing las ni dper na dkon mchog gsum gyi ched du gtsug lag khang bzhengs pa la sogs pa rdzas byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rnams las bsod nams kyi phung po ji srid du 'di rnams rgyun mi 'chad pa'i bar du nye bar skye
translated: The field of action is, for example, the merit that arises from the field of action of giving material things, such as building a temple for the sake of the Three Jewels, and so on, as long as they are not destroyed.

original: la nye bar skyes pa yang mi zad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: la nye bar skyes pa yang mi zad pa lta bu ste /
translated: The merit that arises from giving material things is inexhaustible.

original: ji skad du khang bu brtsegs pa'i mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du khang bu brtsegs pa'i mdor gsungs pa /
translated: As the Mansion of the Buddha Sutra declares:

original: kun dga' bo sangs rgyas la bskrun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'khor bar mi zad de mya ngan las 'das pa'ang thob par byed do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo sangs rgyas la bskrun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'khor bar mi zad de mya ngan las 'das pa'ang thob par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúAnanda, the roots of virtue planted in the Buddha do not perish in samsara and they bring attainment of nirvana.

original: de bzhin du chos la bskrun pa dang dge 'dun la bskrun pa yang ngo zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos la bskrun pa dang dge 'dun la bskrun pa yang ngo zhes so //
translated: Likewise, the roots of virtue planted in the Dharma and the Sangha do not perish in samsara and they bring attainment of nirvana.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du chom rkun pa'i don du skyed tshal la sogs pa rnams byed pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po ji srid de rnams rgyun mi 'chad kyi bar du ste gang gi phyir chom rkun pa rnams ni de la brten nas grong gi sems can
analyzed: de bzhin du chom rkun pa'i don du skyed tshal la sogs pa rnams byed pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po ji srid de rnams rgyun mi 'chad kyi bar du ste gang gi phyir chom rkun pa rnams ni de la brten nas grong gi sems can
translated: Similarly, as long as the thieves and so on are not satisfied, the mass of nonmeritorious karma is generated for the thieves and so on who create the garden and so on for the purpose of thieves and so on.üîΩ

original: la sogs pa 'phrog par byed pas so ;
analyzed: la sogs pa 'phrog par byed pas so ;
translated: Likewise, for the sake of thieves, when a garden and so on is created, the mass of demerit is as long as the thieves are uninterrupted, because the thieves, in dependence on that, steal the sentient beings of the village and so on.

original: / de bzhin du rdzong gi khang pa byed pa la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du rdzong gi khang pa byed pa la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, it should be understood that the creation of a fortress and so on is similar.

original: bsam pa las de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba las ji srid du bsod nams rgyun mi 'chad la /
analyzed: bsam pa las de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba las ji srid du bsod nams rgyun mi 'chad la /
translated: From intention, the merit of the Three Jewels, the Tathagata and so on, is uninterrupted as long as one goes for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: bzlog pas bsod nams ma yin pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: bzlog pas bsod nams ma yin pa lta bu'o ;
translated: The opposite is demerit.

original: / bya ba nges pa las ni dper na dam pa'i chos ma bklags par bza' bar mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams te bya ba rnam par chad pa las kyang ldog pa dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa la ni bya ba nges pa
analyzed: / bya ba nges pa las ni dper na dam pa'i chos ma bklags par bza' bar mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams te bya ba rnam par chad pa las kyang ldog pa dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa la ni bya ba nges pa
translated: From the determination of the action, for example, merit from the determination of the action, as in the statement, ‚ÄúOne should not eat without having studied the holy Dharma,‚Äù and also from the cessation of the action, one turns away from killing, etc.

original: las bsod nams ma yin pa ste nges pa btang ba dang bya ba chad pa las @80a * //üîΩkyang ldog pa lta bu'o //üîΩdngos po yongs su 'dzin pa las ni dper na 'ga' zhig mchod pa'i ched du mchod rten la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / cig shos pha rol la gnod pa'i ched du rgyu  dang 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa lta bu ste de dag gis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag de yongs su btang ba las ldog go //
analyzed: las bsod nams ma yin pa ste nges pa btang ba dang bya ba chad pa las @80a * // kyang ldog pa lta bu'o // dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa las ni dper na 'ga' zhig mchod pa'i ched du mchod rten la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / cig shos pha rol la gnod pa'i ched du rgyu  dang 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa lta bu ste de dag gis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag de yongs su btang ba las ldog go //
translated: From the relinquishment of the determination, non-merit, and from the cessation of the action, one turns away from killing, etc.üîΩFrom the relinquishment of the object, for example, merit from the relinquishment of a stupa, etc., which one has taken up for the purpose of worship, and from the relinquishment of a weapon, etc., which another has taken up for the purpose of harming others.

original: 'bad pas 'jug pa la ni /
analyzed: 'bad pas 'jug pa la ni /
translated: From the engagement through effort, for example, merit from the effort to engage in giving, etc., and non-merit from the effort to engage in killing, etc.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig dad pa'i shugs sam nyon mongs pa'i shugs las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'bad pas byed de de ji srid shugs rjes su 'jug pa de srid du bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa yang ngo zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig dad pa'i shugs sam nyon mongs pa'i shugs las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'bad pas byed de de ji srid shugs rjes su 'jug pa de srid du bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa yang ngo zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, some people, through the power of faith or the power of affliction, make effort to do virtuous or nonvirtuous karma. As long as the power of faith or affliction continues, so too merit or demerit continues.

original: de ltar sdom pa can dang sdom pa ma yin pa can dag gis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa rjes su 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sdom pa can dang sdom pa ma yin pa can dag gis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa rjes su 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be understood that those who possess vows and those who possess negative commitments have merit and demerit.

original: de ltar na sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dag 'phangs pa'i dus las tshu rol du gtong ba med dam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dag 'phangs pa'i dus las tshu rol du gtong ba med dam zhe na /
translated: If one asks whether vows and negative commitments are relinquished before the time of their projection,

original: yod de sdom pa de srid du yang dag par blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i rnam par rig byed skyes na ste /
analyzed: yod de sdom pa de srid du yang dag par blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i rnam par rig byed skyes na ste /
translated: they are relinquished when indicative form that is incompatible with the vows arises and contradicts the vows.

original: mtshan nyid ji lta bar bslab pa phul ba dang tshul khrims dang mi mthun pa mi gsod pa dang rdzas yongs su rdzogs pa rku ba dang gzhan gyi bud med la bgrod pa dang / rang gis rtogs pa'i brdzun 'phags pa'i rtogs pa dang ldan par go bar byed pa'i bdag nyid ltung bar 'gyur ba'i chos spyod pa las dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji lta bar bslab pa phul ba dang tshul khrims dang mi mthun pa mi gsod pa dang rdzas yongs su rdzogs pa rku ba dang gzhan gyi bud med la bgrod pa dang / rang gis rtogs pa'i brdzun 'phags pa'i rtogs pa dang ldan par go bar byed pa'i bdag nyid ltung bar 'gyur ba'i chos spyod pa las dang /
translated: The nature of the vows is to abandon the four root offenses: to offer training in the characteristics of the vows, to not kill those who do not accord with ethical conduct, to not steal all the property of others and to not have sexual intercourse with the wives of others and to not lie about one‚Äôs own realization, making others understand that one possesses the realization of an ƒÅrya.

original: mtshan gnyis byung ba las te rten rnam par 'khrugs pas dbang po ma yin pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis byung ba las te rten rnam par 'khrugs pas dbang po ma yin pa thob pa'o //
translated: The basis is disturbed by the arising of two organs, whereby one obtains a nonorgan.

original: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni rten chad pas shi ba las gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa ni rten chad pas shi ba las gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The vows of one day long are relinquished by severing the basis, death.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dang rten rnam par 'khrugs pa las so //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dang rten rnam par 'khrugs pa las so //
translated: Nonvows are relinquished by taking vows and by disturbing the basis.

original: sdom pa yan lag gsum pa zhes pa la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de la gang gi yan lag 'di rnams yin pa sdom pa gzhan 'ga' zhig ni med do 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: sdom pa yan lag gsum pa zhes pa la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de la gang gi yan lag 'di rnams yin pa sdom pa gzhan 'ga' zhig ni med do 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The vows that possess three branches and so on were stated by the BhagavƒÅn.

original: 'di'i yan lag gsum rnams yin pas yan lag gsum tshogs pa sdom pa ste de tshogs pa'i cha shas rnams ni yan lag rnams te dper na dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yan lag gsum rnams yin pas yan lag gsum tshogs pa sdom pa ste de tshogs pa'i cha shas rnams ni yan lag rnams te dper na dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Since these are the three branches of the lay practitioner, the collection of the three branches is the vow. The parts of the collection of the three branches are the three branches, just as an army with four branches is called an army with four parts.

original: de bzhin du sdom pa yan lag lnga pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdom pa yan lag lnga pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: Similarly, the five-branched vow and so on are also like this.

original: yan lag lnga ni @80b srog gcod pa zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'ang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga ni @80b srog gcod pa zhes pa la sogs pa rnams su'ang rig par bya'o //
translated: The five branches should be understood as the five precepts such as abandoning taking life.

original: 'dir gang dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa yan lag lnga pa yang dag par blangs pa de mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyang spangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir gang dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa yan lag lnga pa yang dag par blangs pa de mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyang spangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, if one perfectly accepts the five-branched vow of the lay practitioner, one also abandons the ten nonvirtuous karmic paths.

original: brdzun du smra ba spangs pas ni phra ma dang tshig rtsub pa dang ngag 'khyal pa rnams spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba spangs pas ni phra ma dang tshig rtsub pa dang ngag 'khyal pa rnams spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: By abandoning lying, one also abandons slander, harsh words, and idle speech.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi legs par spyod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi legs par spyod pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one comes to possess good conduct.

original: 'o na brdzun du smras pa kho na las ldog par brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'o na brdzun du smras pa kho na las ldog par brjod kyi /
translated: If one only turns away from lying,

original: lus kyi nyes par spyod pa thams cad so so ba las bzhin du ngag gi nyes par spyod pa thams cad las ma yin pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi nyes par spyod pa thams cad so so ba las bzhin du ngag gi nyes par spyod pa thams cad las ma yin pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is it that all physical negative actions are like individual karmic paths, but all verbal negative actions are not?

analyzed: bsags pa 'di kho na la tha snyad 'jug pa 'ba' zhig ste snga ma ma yin la gnyis pa ma yin no //
translated: This accumulation alone is the only one that is engaged in convention, not the former and not the latter.

original: sdom pa gong ma gong ma mtha' dag nyid so sor yang dag par blangs pa las skye ba dang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdom pa gong ma gong ma mtha' dag nyid so sor yang dag par blangs pa las skye ba dang gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all higher vows arise and endure through the perfect reception of each.

original: gal te de lta na de'i tshe srog gcod pa la sogs pa spong ba mang po rnams la khyad par ram nye bar mkho ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na de'i tshe srog gcod pa la sogs pa spong ba mang po rnams la khyad par ram nye bar mkho ba ci yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then what is the difference or need for many vows such as abandoning taking life and so on?

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa spong ba nyid kyis na khyad par cung zad kyang med de rigs mtshungs pa'i phyir rigs mthun pa'i gser gyi rgyan du ma bzhin no ;
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa spong ba nyid kyis na khyad par cung zad kyang med de rigs mtshungs pa'i phyir rigs mthun pa'i gser gyi rgyan du ma bzhin no ;
translated: There is not the slightest difference, because they are similar in abandoning taking life and so on, just as many ornaments of similar gold are.

original: /'o na ci ltar tha dad ce na /
analyzed: /'o na ci ltar tha dad ce na /
translated: If that is so, how are they different?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang dang po'i rgyu tha dad pa las te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang dang po'i rgyu tha dad pa las te /
translated: They are different because their intrinsic natures and their initial causes are different.

original: phyi rol gyi lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par dang nang gi lhag pa'i bsam pa phul du byung ba bsags pa dang sems pa'i khyad par las gong ma'i spong ba rnams skyes pa'i phyir bzo bo mkhas pas byas pa'i rigs mtshungs pa'i rgyan bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par dang nang gi lhag pa'i bsam pa phul du byung ba bsags pa dang sems pa'i khyad par las gong ma'i spong ba rnams skyes pa'i phyir bzo bo mkhas pas byas pa'i rigs mtshungs pa'i rgyan bzhin no //
translated: Higher vows arise from special external cooperative conditions, special internal superior intention, and special mental contemplation.

original: de lta na sdom pa so so gzhan yang dag par len pa na skyabs su 'gro ba rnams so sor bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na sdom pa so so gzhan yang dag par len pa na skyabs su 'gro ba rnams so sor bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then when one perfectly takes up each individual vow, one should go for refuge individually.

original: 'di rnams sdom pa gzhan yang dag par len pa'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na bya ste dgag pa byed pa su'ang med do //
analyzed: 'di rnams sdom pa gzhan yang dag par len pa'i sgor gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na bya ste dgag pa byed pa su'ang med do //
translated: There is no one to refute this, because going for refuge is the door for perfectly taking up other vows.

original: gzhan ni skyabs su khas len pa tsam don du gnyer ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir de'ang byang chub kyi bar nyid du khyad par med na len cig khas blangs pas grub pa'i phyir na sdom pa yang dag par len pa rnams la 'jug pa'i dang por gyur
analyzed: gzhan ni skyabs su khas len pa tsam don du gnyer ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir de'ang byang chub kyi bar nyid du khyad par med na len cig khas blangs pas grub pa'i phyir na sdom pa yang dag par len pa rnams la 'jug pa'i dang por gyur
translated: Others assert that going for refuge is merely a promise and that is not a special cause for attaining enlightenment, but if one promises to take up vows, one will attain enlightenment.üîΩTherefore, going for refuge is the first step for those who perfectly take up vows.

original: pa dang de'i tshe khas blangs pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'di tsam nyid kyis sdom pa so so yang dag par len pa'i sgo'i dngos por grub pa'i phyir slar yang skyabs su 'gro ba ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: pa dang de'i tshe khas blangs pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'di tsam nyid kyis sdom pa so so yang dag par len pa'i sgo'i dngos por grub pa'i phyir slar yang skyabs su 'gro ba ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: and at that time there is no difference in the vow. Therefore, by this alone, the basis of the rite of taking the individual perfect vows is established, and there is no need for going for refuge again.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba de nyid ni don gyis so so bzhin du tha snyad du bya la /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba de nyid ni don gyis so so bzhin du tha snyad du bya la /
translated: That going for refuge is conventionally designated according to its meaning.

original: gang gis sdom pa phyi ma yongs su gtang ba na'ang sdom pa snga ma mi ldog ste skyabs su 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir dang sdom pa rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis sdom pa phyi ma yongs su gtang ba na'ang sdom pa snga ma mi ldog ste skyabs su 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir dang sdom pa rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when the later vow is relinquished, the former vow is not relinquished, because the going for refuge exists and the vows are distinct.

original: gzhan du na sdom pa phyi ma gtang ba nyid las sdom pa thams cad gtang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste 'di ni spong ba mang po rnams kyi nye bar mkho ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na sdom pa phyi ma gtang ba nyid las sdom pa thams cad gtang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste 'di ni spong ba mang po rnams kyi nye bar mkho ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, by relinquishing the later vow, all vows would be relinquished. This is the requirement for the many vows.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas byang chub sems dpa' @90a * //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas byang chub sems dpa' @90a * //
translated: In this way, by the process of expression, the bodhisattva

original: byang chub sems bskyed pa ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin sdom pa'i tshul khrims la brtan por byas nas 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dge ba'i chos sdud kyi tshul khrims dang sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims dang thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa dang sbyin
analyzed: byang chub sems bskyed pa ldog pa'i tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin sdom pa'i tshul khrims la brtan por byas nas 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dge ba'i chos sdud kyi tshul khrims dang sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims dang thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa dang sbyin
translated: Having stabilized the nature of the morality of restraint, one should practice the morality of acquiring virtue, the morality of acting for the benefit of living beings, and the perfections such as generosity, in order to accumulate the two collections of merit and knowledge.

original: pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yang dag par sgrub pa la'ang tshogs gnyis bsags pa'i ched du stobs ji lta bas tshogs kyi sar mi dmigs par goms par bya'o //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yang dag par sgrub pa la'ang tshogs gnyis bsags pa'i ched du stobs ji lta bas tshogs kyi sar mi dmigs par goms par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate nonapprehension on the stage of accumulating, according to one's ability.

original: de la dge ba ni ngo bo nyid dang 'brel ba dang rjes su 'brel pa dang slong ba dang skye bas thob pa dang nor dam pa dang ; sbyor ba dang phan 'dogs pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa dang mdun du byed pa dang gnyen po dang nye bar zhi ba dang rgyu mthun pa las so //
analyzed: de la dge ba ni ngo bo nyid dang 'brel ba dang rjes su 'brel pa dang slong ba dang skye bas thob pa dang nor dam pa dang ; sbyor ba dang phan 'dogs pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa dang mdun du byed pa dang gnyen po dang nye bar zhi ba dang rgyu mthun pa las so //
translated: Therein, virtue is related to essence, related to consequence, related to instigation, obtained from birth, excellent wealth, application, assistance, possession, preeminence, antidote, pacification, and natural outcome.

original: de la ngo bo nyid las ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa dang 'dod chags med pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang dgu ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid las ni dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang ngo tsha dang khrel yod pa dang 'dod chags med pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang dgu ste /
translated: The roots are nine in number: faith, energy, mnemotechnic, concentration, insight, conscience, shame, non-greed, and non-hatred.

original: gti mug med pa ni shes rab nyid kyi phyir la /
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni shes rab nyid kyi phyir la /
translated: Non-delusion is insight itself.

original: bag yod dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms dang rnam par 'tshe ba se sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: bag yod dang shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms dang rnam par 'tshe ba se sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Conscientiousness, serenity, equanimity, and non-violence are mental factors.

original: btang snyoms ni sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do //üîΩ'brel pa las de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so ;
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do // 'brel pa las de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so ;
translated: Equanimity is the evenness of mind.üîΩThose associated with it are associated with those roots.

original: / rjes su 'brel pa las de rnams nyid kyi bag chags gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: / rjes su 'brel pa las de rnams nyid kyi bag chags gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those which are related to it are the instincts of those roots.

original: slong ba la des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: slong ba la des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: The instigation is the bodily and vocal actions instigated by them.

original: skye bas thob pa las ni dge ba'i chos 'di rnams nyid sngon goms par byas pa la brten nas de'i ngo bo rnam par smin par 'grub ste gang gis de rnams kho na la so sor ma brtags par 'dod pa kun du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa las ni dge ba'i chos 'di rnams nyid sngon goms par byas pa la brten nas de'i ngo bo rnam par smin par 'grub ste gang gis de rnams kho na la so sor ma brtags par 'dod pa kun du gnas pa'o //
translated: The virtues acquired by birth are established by the maturation of the nature of those virtues, based on previous practice of those virtues, by reason of which one naturally abides in the desire for them.

original: don dam pa las de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa las de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The virtues of reality are suchness.

original: sbyor ba las ni skyes bu dam pa la brten nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las ni skyes bu dam pa la brten nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'o //
translated: The virtues of application are listening to the holy Dharma, reflecting correctly, and cultivating the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, based on reliance on holy persons.

original: phan 'dogs pa las ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi rnams kyis sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa las ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi rnams kyis sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The virtues of assistance are the virtues of assisting sentient beings by means of the four social practices.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa las ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos pos sam tshul khrims las byung bas sam /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa las ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos pos sam tshul khrims las byung bas sam /
translated: The virtues of possession are the virtues of the material for the creation of merit that arises from giving, or that arises from morality, or that arises from meditation.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i phyug po dang rigs mthon por skye ba yongs su @90b 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i phyug po dang rigs mthon por skye ba yongs su @90b 'dzin pa'am /
translated: It is the acquisition of wealth and high birth that come from meditation,

original: mtho ris su skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'am rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'am rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: or the acquisition of rebirth in the heavens, or the acquisition of what is favorable to purification.

original: mdun du byed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am mchod rten nam sku gzugs mdun du byas pa'am chos sam chos kyi gzhi gang zag gam glegs bam mdun du byas te mchod pa byed pa las so //
analyzed: mdun du byed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am mchod rten nam sku gzugs mdun du byas pa'am chos sam chos kyi gzhi gang zag gam glegs bam mdun du byas te mchod pa byed pa las so //
translated: Worship that is done in the presence is that which is done in the presence of the Tathagata, or of a stupa, or of an image of the Buddha. It is also that which is done in the presence of the Dharma, either in the form of a book or a recitation, or in the presence of the spiritual community.

original: gnyen po las ni gang rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po dang rnam par gnon pa gnyen po dang thag bsring ba gnyen po dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gnyen po las ni gang rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po dang rnam par gnon pa gnyen po dang thag bsring ba gnyen po dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Worship that is done as an antidote is that which is done by way of the antidotes of thorough repudiation, thorough restraint, thorough removal, the afflictions, and the knowable.

original: nye bar zhi ba las ni gang de la brten nas chags pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba las ni gang de la brten nas chags pa spong ba'o //
translated: Worship that is done as pacification is that which is done in order to abandon attachment to those objects of worship.

original: rgyu mthun pa las ni de'i dbang gis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las ni de'i dbang gis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The natural outflow is the knowledge of the world and of what is supramundane, common and uncommon, through the power of that.

original: 'dir sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos pos sam zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: 'dir sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos pos sam zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa de la /
translated: Here, it is said that the merit that arises from giving is the basis of action, etc.

original: rgyu la ma yat ste /
analyzed: rgyu la ma yat ste /
translated: Here, the cause is not the basis.

original: sbyin pa'i rgyu can sbyin pa las byung ba dang de bzhin du tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i rgyu can khrims las byung ba dang bsgom pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rgyu can sbyin pa las byung ba dang de bzhin du tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i rgyu can khrims las byung ba dang bsgom pa las byung ba ste /
translated: That which has giving as its cause is that which arises from giving. Likewise, that which arises from morality and that which arises from meditation have morality and meditation as their cause.

original: zas las byung ba srog chags rnams rtsva las byung ba ba lang rnams zhes pa la bu'o //
analyzed: zas las byung ba srog chags rnams rtsva las byung ba ba lang rnams zhes pa la bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúbeings who arise from food‚Äù and ‚Äúcows who arise from grass.‚Äù

original: yang na rang bzhin la ma yat ste /
analyzed: yang na rang bzhin la ma yat ste /
translated: Or, the nature is not the basis.

original: sbyin pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i bsod nams ni sbyin pa'i rang bzhin dang de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i bsod nams ni sbyin pa'i rang bzhin dang de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin dang bsgom pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The merit that has the nature of giving is the nature of giving. Likewise, the nature of morality and the nature of meditation are the nature of morality and the nature of meditation.

original: 'jim pa'i rang bzhin gyi snod ces pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i rang bzhin gyi snod ces pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a pot which is by nature clay.

original: bsod nams zhes pa'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams zhes pa'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of merit?

original: yang dang yang dge legs kyi ched du 'gyur pa'i phyir bsod nams so //
analyzed: yang dang yang dge legs kyi ched du 'gyur pa'i phyir bsod nams so //
translated: It is merit because it is repeatedly favorable for the sake of what is virtuous and excellent.

original: yang na skyes bu dag tu 'jug par byed dag par byed pa'i phyir bsod nams so //
analyzed: yang na skyes bu dag tu 'jug par byed dag par byed pa'i phyir bsod nams so //
translated: Or, it is merit because it causes the entry of beings into purity.

original: de yang lus la sogs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: de yang lus la sogs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is virtue that is associated with body, etc.

original: sbyin pa 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this giving?

original: gang gis ster bar byed pa de sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis ster bar byed pa de sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is giving because it causes the gift to be given.

original: 'gran pa dang grags pa 'dod pa dang 'jigs pa dang re ba dang bsten pa'i don du gang ster ba de ni sbyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gran pa dang grags pa 'dod pa dang 'jigs pa dang re ba dang bsten pa'i don du gang ster ba de ni sbyin pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is given out of rivalry, fame, fear, hope, or dependence is not giving.

original: 'o na ci zhe na mchod pa dang phan gdags pa'i don du ste yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa rnams la mchod pa'i bsam pas ster ba dang de las gzhan pa rnams la ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la phan gdags @91a *
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na mchod pa dang phan gdags pa'i don du ste yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa rnams la mchod pa'i bsam pas ster ba dang de las gzhan pa rnams la ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po la phan gdags @91a *
translated: What then is it? It is giving when given with the intention of worship and service, given with the intention of worship to those who have attained nirvana, and given to others for the sake of benefiting the great elements of the faculties.

original: // par bya 'dod pas te gang gi don du ster bar bshad do //
analyzed: // par bya 'dod pas te gang gi don du ster bar bshad do //
translated: The word give is explained as to give for the sake of what is desired.

original: yang cis ster bar byed ce na sems la sogs pa tshogs pas kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyi ste 'di ni sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang cis ster bar byed ce na sems la sogs pa tshogs pas kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyi ste 'di ni sbyin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: By what does one give? By the karma of body and speech motivated by the collection of mind and mental factors. This is the definition of giving.

original: de skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gang tshe skyes bu rang nyid rdzas //
analyzed: gang tshe skyes bu rang nyid rdzas //
translated: When a person gives his own goods

original: dge ba'i yid kyis sbyin byed pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i yid kyis sbyin byed pa //
translated: with a virtuous mind,

original: skad cig de la dge ba yi //
analyzed: skad cig de la dge ba yi //
translated: in that moment the collection of virtue

original: phung po sbyin pa zhes brjod bya //
analyzed: phung po sbyin pa zhes brjod bya //
translated: is called 'giving.'

original: zhes so // gtso bo las ni sems nyid sbyin pa ste //
analyzed: zhes so // gtso bo las ni sems nyid sbyin pa ste //
translated: The mind itself is the chief giving.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: rang gi rdzas nyid yongs su btang nas gzhan gyi rdzas su byed pa'i sems ni sbyin pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: rang gi rdzas nyid yongs su btang nas gzhan gyi rdzas su byed pa'i sems ni sbyin pa'o zhes so //
translated: The mind that gives up one's own goods and makes them the goods of others is giving.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu ci zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi 'bras bu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the result of the merit that comes from giving?

original: sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'da' bar bsngos pas thar pa'i 'bras bu dang 'bras bus longs spyod chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'da' bar bsngos pas thar pa'i 'bras bu dang 'bras bus longs spyod chen po'o //
translated: Since it is dedicated to the nirvana of all sentient beings, it has the result of liberation and the result of great enjoyment.

original: 'bras bu longs spyod chen po nyid ni rgya che ba dang gya nom pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu longs spyod chen po nyid ni rgya che ba dang gya nom pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The result is the great enjoyment of the result, because it is the result of the uninterrupted great extent and excellence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don dang mthun pa'i ming ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don dang mthun pa'i ming ste /
translated: Therefore, it is a name that corresponds to the meaning.

original: ster ba po dang len pa po dag gi dbul ba'i gdung ba sel bar byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ster ba po dang len pa po dag gi dbul ba'i gdung ba sel bar byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is generosity because it removes the suffering of poverty of both the giver and the receiver.

original: khyad par med par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po yin la de'i khyad par yang rgyu brgyad rnams kyis te zhing las dang dngos po dang yid la byed pa dang bsam pa dang ; de las gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa dang rten dang mang du byed pa dang skye bo mang po las kyang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par med par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po yin la de'i khyad par yang rgyu brgyad rnams kyis te zhing las dang dngos po dang yid la byed pa dang bsam pa dang ; de las gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa dang rten dang mang du byed pa dang skye bo mang po las kyang ngo //
translated: The result of generosity is great enjoyment, without distinction. Its excellence is due to eight causes: field, substance, mental attitude, intention, holding something else as more important, support, repetition, and a multitude of beings.

original: de la zhing ni 'gro ba dang sdug bsngal dang phan gdags pa nyid dang yon tan rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhing ni 'gro ba dang sdug bsngal dang phan gdags pa nyid dang yon tan rnams kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The field is superior due to the distinctions of world, suffering, benefit, and virtues.

original: 'gro ba'i khyad par bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i khyad par bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: who are the recipients of generosity:üîΩ‚ÄúOne should expect a hundredfold karmic maturationüîΩfor generosity to those who have gone to the animal birthplace.

original: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su song ba la sbyin pa byin nas rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su song ba la sbyin pa byin nas rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
translated: One should expect a thousandfold karmic maturation

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa mir gyur pa stong 'gyur du'o zhes so //

translated: Here, the result of the giver is distinguished by the destruction of the distinction of suffering, that is, the suffering of the recipient, from the distinction of conditions.

analyzed: 'di ni rdzas las byung ba las dper brjod pa ste kha cig tu yon tan ldan pa'i zhing las kyang dper brjod la /

analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyi khyad par las dper brjod de 'dir yang sngon ma'o //

analyzed: phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi khyad par las ni ji ltar ma dang pha dag phan 'dogs pa gzhan rnams la yang ngo //

analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par las ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa la byin pa ni rnam par smin pa 'bum 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu ste /

analyzed: gal te yon tan dang ldan pa'i yon gnas zhing du 'gyur ba de la sbyin pa 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa'i zhing de'ang sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams sam /

analyzed: zhing mnyam po la gnyis dag gi su'i stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya zhe na /
translated: If two people give to the same field, whose action should be known as having great power?

original: dngos po las te gang ni nor bu dang dngul dang gser la sogs pa'i dngos po gya nom pa dang mang bar gyur pa de'i dngos po'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa las stobs dang ldan pa'i las byung ste cig shos kyis ma yin no //

translated: The power of action arises from the excellence of the object, not from the excellence of the agent, because the action of giving is powerful when the object is excellent and abundant, not when the opposite is true.

original: dngos po'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par ni ji ltar kha dog phun sum tshogs pa byin @92a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par ni ji ltar kha dog phun sum tshogs pa byin @92a * //

analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya'o zhes pa ni sbyin pa'i khyad par te /

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams brjod zin to //
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams brjod zin to //

translated: Morality also perfects great resources for the sake of heaven, but generosity is primary.

original: tshul khrims kyang thob byed kyi rgyu nyid las bral ba'i ched du ste gtso bo ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang thob byed kyi rgyu nyid las bral ba'i ched du ste gtso bo ni sgom pa'o //
translated: Morality also perfects the cause of obtaining freedom from attachment, but meditation is primary.

original: ci ltar tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu byang grol yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu byang grol yin zhe na /
translated: How is the result of morality liberation?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pas smon lam 'grub ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pas smon lam 'grub ste /
translated: One who has morality fulfills his vow.

original: de'ang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa nyid las so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang rnam @93a * //
analyzed: de'ang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa nyid las so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // yang rnam @93a * //

original: par dag pa ni thar pa thob par byed pa'i tshogs kyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: par dag pa ni thar pa thob par byed pa'i tshogs kyi tshul khrims so //
translated: Purity is the morality of the collection that causes the attainment of liberation.

original: 'di lta ste rnam par rtog pas nye bar 'joms pa'i gnyen por dbang po'i sgo bzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rnam par rtog pas nye bar 'joms pa'i gnyen por dbang po'i sgo bzung ba'o //
translated: Thus, the antidote to the destruction by discursive thought is the guarding of the sense-doors.
