analyzed: rten las su mi rung bas nye bar 'joms pa'i gnyen por zas kyi tshod shes pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the destruction by unserviceability of the basis is the knowledge of the right amount of food.

original: tshod 'dzin pa ni dma' ba dang lhag pa'i zas yongs su spong ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshod 'dzin pa ni dma' ba dang lhag pa'i zas yongs su spong ba'i don to //
translated: The right amount of food means the avoidance of low and excessive food.

original: chung ba'i zas kyis rten nyam chung ba nyid kyis mngon par mi spro ba'o //
analyzed: chung ba'i zas kyis rten nyam chung ba nyid kyis mngon par mi spro ba'o //
translated: Low food is the unserviceability of the basis due to weakness from little food.

original: zas ha cang ches na gnyid la sogs pa skyon lnga kun du spyod pa las rten las su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: zas ha cang ches na gnyid la sogs pa skyon lnga kun du spyod pa las rten las su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: Excessive food is the unserviceability of the basis due to the indulgence in the five faults such as sleepiness.

original: de ltar gnyis kas rten las su mi rung ba nyid de de med na dge ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis kas rten las su mi rung ba nyid de de med na dge ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Thus, both are unserviceability of the basis, and in the absence of that, there is what is favorable to the side of virtue.

original: mi brtson pas nye bar 'joms pa'i gnyen por nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi gnyid par rnal 'byor la rjes su sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mi brtson pas nye bar 'joms pa'i gnyen por nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi gnyid par rnal 'byor la rjes su sbyor ba'o //
translated: The remedy for the destruction by non-exertion is the application to yoga without sleep in the first and last periods of the night.

original: 'gyod pas nye bar 'joms pa'i gnyen por shes bzhin la gnas pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pas nye bar 'joms pa'i gnyen por shes bzhin la gnas pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: The remedy for the destruction by regret is the very state of vigilance.

original: bsgom pa las byung ba yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge ba ste gang mnyam par gzhag pa'i rang bzhin dang de dang lhan cig gyur pa'i bsod nams de bsgom pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba yang mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge ba ste gang mnyam par gzhag pa'i rang bzhin dang de dang lhan cig gyur pa'i bsod nams de bsgom pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which arises from cultivation is virtue in equipoise, for that which is of the nature of equipoise and the merit that accompanies it is called cultivation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na sems la bsgo ba'i phyir te de ltar ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge bas me tog rnams kyis til ltar yon tan rnams kyi sems la rtag tu shin tu bsgo bar byed cing de'i rang bzhin du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na sems la bsgo ba'i phyir te de ltar ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge bas me tog rnams kyis til ltar yon tan rnams kyi sems la rtag tu shin tu bsgo bar byed cing de'i rang bzhin du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because it is the cultivation of the mind, for in this way, the virtue of equipoise always and completely cultivates the mind with qualities like flowers on sesame seeds and makes it their nature.

original: bsgom pa las byung ba yang mdor bsdu na 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba yang mdor bsdu na 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of cultivation is also, in brief, mundane and supramundane.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam ni bsam gtan rnams dang gzugs med pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam ni bsam gtan rnams dang gzugs med pa rnams so //
translated: The mundane path is the meditative development of the absorptions and formless-attainments.

original: de rnams dang 'di rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang rnam par gzhag pa dang rnam par dag pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang 'di rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang rnam par gzhag pa dang rnam par dag pa rnams kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known through: defilement, purification, arrangement and complete clearing.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu zhe na lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu zhe na lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi ste /
translated: How so through defilement? Through the four indeterminate roots:

original: sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'o //
translated: craving, view, pride and ignorance.

original: sred pas ni bde ba'i ro myong bas kun nas nyon mongs te shin tu sbyong ba'i bde ba la ro myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pas ni bde ba'i ro myong bas kun nas nyon mongs te shin tu sbyong ba'i bde ba la ro myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Through craving, there is defilement through the experience of the taste of pleasure, because of the experience of the taste of the pleasure of tranquility.

original: lta bas ni lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs te bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mthar rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta bas ni lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs te bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mthar rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: View afflicts meditative absorption that is dominated by view, because one generates the views of speculation about the past, etc., in dependence on meditative absorption.

original: nga rgyal gyis @93b nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs te de'i khyad par rtogs pas khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis @93b nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs te de'i khyad par rtogs pas khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Pride afflicts meditative absorption that is dominated by pride, because one becomes conceited through the realization of its special qualities.

original: ma rig pa ni the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ste de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa thar pa 'dod pa khyad par te rtogs pa la thar pa'am thar pa min pa zhes the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ste de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa thar pa 'dod pa khyad par te rtogs pa la thar pa'am thar pa min pa zhes the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ignorance afflicts meditative absorption that is dominated by doubt, because one who does not understand reality and who desires liberation generates doubt about liberation, thinking, ‚ÄúIs this liberation or not?‚Äù

original: rnam par byang bas ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par byang bas ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: How does purification afflict?

original: dag pa'i bsam gtan la sogs pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyang dge ba'i phyir kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral bas rnam par byang ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dag pa'i bsam gtan la sogs pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyang dge ba'i phyir kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral bas rnam par byang ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The mundane concentrations, etc., which are pure are also called ‚Äúpurified‚Äù because they are virtuous and free from the stain of the entanglements.

original: rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na bsam gtan dang po yan lag lnga pa zhes pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na bsam gtan dang po yan lag lnga pa zhes pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pas so //
translated: How are they established? They are established as the first concentration with five members, etc.

original: rnam par dag pas ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pas ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they purified?

original: rab kyi mtha' yas pa'i bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar rnam par dag pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rab kyi mtha' yas pa'i bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar rnam par dag pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The first concentration, etc., up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception are purified.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The supramundane path is the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: lam gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang ste bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar ro //
analyzed: lam gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang ste bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar ro //
translated: The concentrations associated with the two paths are the first concentration up to the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ni 'jig rten nyid de /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched ni 'jig rten nyid de /
translated: The sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is mundane.

original: yongs su gsal ba'i 'du shes rab tu rgyu ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gsal ba'i 'du shes rab tu rgyu ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the notion of complete clarity does not occur.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus the BhagavƒÅn has said:

original: ji srid du 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du kun shes pa rtogs so zhes so //
analyzed: ji srid du 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du kun shes pa rtogs so zhes so //
translated: As long as there is the meditative attainment of ideation, there is the realization of complete knowledge.

original: 'o na bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes pa'i don ci zhe na gsum pa 'di ni ji ltar rigs par bsod nams kyang yin dngos po'ang yin pas bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: 'o na bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po zhes pa'i don ci zhe na gsum pa 'di ni ji ltar rigs par bsod nams kyang yin dngos po'ang yin pas bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: What is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbases of meritorious action‚Äù? The third is a meritorious action and a basis, so it is a ‚Äúbase of meritorious action,‚Äù as is appropriate.

original: re zhig sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la lus ngag gi las ni 'di rnam pa gsum char du 'gyur te bsod nams kyang yin bya ba'ang yin bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'ang yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la lus ngag gi las ni 'di rnam pa gsum char du 'gyur te bsod nams kyang yin bya ba'ang yin bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po'ang yin zhes pa'o //
translated: In the first case, the meritorious action that arises from giving is a meritorious action, a basis, and a meritorious action that is a basis, because it is physical and verbal action.

original: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ni bsod nams kyang yin bya ba'ang yin no //
analyzed: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ni bsod nams kyang yin bya ba'ang yin no //
translated: The intention that motivates that is a meritorious action and a basis.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni bsod nams kho na'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni bsod nams kho na'o //
translated: The factors that are concomitant with it are only merit.

original: lus ngag gi las ni kho na dngos po'o //
analyzed: lus ngag gi las ni kho na dngos po'o //
translated: Karma of body and speech are the actual entities.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba ni lus ngag gi las kho na yin pas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba ni lus ngag gi las kho na yin pas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that which arises from morality is only karma of body and speech, it is threefold.

original: bsgom pa las @94a * //üîΩbyung ba la byams pa dang snying rje dag ni bsod nams kyang yin la bya ba'i dngos po'ang ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa las @94a * // byung ba la byams pa dang snying rje dag ni bsod nams kyang yin la bya ba'i dngos po'ang ste /
translated: That which arises from meditationüîΩis merit and also the actual entity of action.

original: byams pa dang snying rje'i sgo nas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje'i sgo nas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Love and compassion are merit and also the actual entity of action, because through love and compassion, intention concomitant with them is actualized.

original: yang na bsod nams byed pa ni bsod nams bya ba ste bsod nams la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bsod nams byed pa ni bsod nams bya ba ste bsod nams la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, that which performs merit is the action of merit, which is the application to merit.

original: 'di rnams ni de'i dngos po ste 'di rnams sgrub pa'i don du bsod nams la rab tu sbyor ba rtsom pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni de'i dngos po ste 'di rnams sgrub pa'i don du bsod nams la rab tu sbyor ba rtsom pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: These are its actual entities, because one applies to merit in order to accomplish these.

original: de ltar dge ba la sogs pa ram par gzhag pa 'di ni phal cher gang zag gzhan dang thun mong du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba la sogs pa ram par gzhag pa 'di ni phal cher gang zag gzhan dang thun mong du bstan pa'o //
translated: This presentation of virtue, etc. is for the most part taught in common with other schools.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni khyad par du'ang rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni khyad par du'ang rgyas par bya'o //
translated: But for the Bodhisattvas it is to be extended in particular.

original: de la sbyin pa ni zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang chos kyi dbye ba las ram pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang chos kyi dbye ba las ram pa gsum mo //
translated: Therein, generosity is threefold, from the point of view of material things, of fearlessness, and of the Dharma.

original: de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni bdag nyid kyi bar du yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni bdag nyid kyi bar du yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Of these, the generosity of material things is the giving up of one's own possessions.

original: chang dang dug dang mtshon la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po ster ba ni bkag pa'o //
analyzed: chang dang dug dang mtshon la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po ster ba ni bkag pa'o //
translated: The generosity of fearlessness is the giving of protection from fear to those who are in danger of being killed, imprisoned, punished, rebuked, or the like.üîΩThe generosity of the Dharma is the teaching of the Dharma in a way that is correct, pure, and free of the desire for material gain, honor, or praise.üîΩThe generosity of material things is of two kinds: giving what is suitable, and giving what is not suitable.

original: gang drag shul can gyis zhus par gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang drag shul can gyis zhus par gsungs pa /
translated: Giving what is not suitable is prohibited, as in the case of the five things not to be given, which are mentioned in the Sagaramatiparipriccha-sutra:

original: gal te 'di rnams la chang gi ltung ba ster na /
analyzed: gal te 'di rnams la chang gi ltung ba ster na /
translated: If you give these to people,

original: de rnams dran pa dang shes bzhin yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug go zhes pa ni der chang sbyin pa'ang dgag pa byas na byang chub sems dpa' la khong khro ba shin tu lci ba dang sems can yang dag par bsdu ba nyams pa ste de las gzhan
analyzed: de rnams dran pa dang shes bzhin yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug go zhes pa ni der chang sbyin pa'ang dgag pa byas na byang chub sems dpa' la khong khro ba shin tu lci ba dang sems can yang dag par bsdu ba nyams pa ste de las gzhan
translated: This means that if one prohibits the giving of alcohol to bodhisattvas, it is a very heavy offense, and it is a degeneration of the correct gathering of sentient beings.

original: rab tu dang ba'i thabs mi srid na chang sbyin par bya'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba'i thabs mi srid na chang sbyin par bya'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: If there is no other means of inspiring faith, one should give alcohol.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag ste /
translated: The giving of fearlessness is the perfections of morality and patience,

original: gnod pa ma skyes pa dang skyes pa la pha rol rnams gdung ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa ma skyes pa dang skyes pa la pha rol rnams gdung ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not torment others with harm that has not yet arisen or that has arisen.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
translated: The giving of Dharma is the perfections of effort, meditative stabilization, and wisdom.

original: mi skyo bar bsam gtan rnams bskyed nas pha rol po rnams kyi bsam pa shes te shes rab kyis yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skyo bar bsam gtan rnams bskyed nas pha rol po rnams kyi bsam pa shes te shes rab kyis yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having generated the meditative stabilizations without discouragement, one understands the thoughts of others and teaches them the correct meaning with wisdom.

original: de ltar ni lan cig la chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pa'i nus pa med pa la dang por bdag la sogs pa bsal bas phyi rol gyi don la bkod nas de'i rjes su khams gsum pa sems tsam du rtogs pa la sbyar ba byas te
analyzed: de ltar ni lan cig la chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pa'i nus pa med pa la dang por bdag la sogs pa bsal bas phyi rol gyi don la bkod nas de'i rjes su khams gsum pa sems tsam du rtogs pa la sbyar ba byas te
translated: Thus, since one does not have the ability to realize that all phenomena are essenceless at once, one first refutes the self and so forth, and then, having established external objects, one subsequently applies oneself to the realization that the three realms are mind only.

original: / de'i rjes su yang dag pa'i don la bya ba rnams rung ba dang mi rung ba @94b yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis kun rdzob gnyis po ma brtags na gcig tu nyams dga' ba rang gi rgyu snga ma snga ma la
analyzed: / de'i rjes su yang dag pa'i don la bya ba rnams rung ba dang mi rung ba @94b yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis kun rdzob gnyis po ma brtags na gcig tu nyams dga' ba rang gi rgyu snga ma snga ma la
translated: After that, one applies oneself to the correct meaning, and through the distinction of what is correct and incorrect, what is and is not possible, one realizes the two obscurations, which are the objects of abandonment, and the two conventional realities, which are the antidotes.

original: rag las par bstan nas yang dag pa'i kun rdzab la gnas te ji ltar mthong ba ltar sgyur ma'i skyes bu lta bus sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rag las par bstan nas yang dag pa'i kun rdzab la gnas te ji ltar mthong ba ltar sgyur ma'i skyes bu lta bus sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: Having shown the dependence, one should abide in the correct conventional, and practice generosity and so forth like a magician who sees things as they are.üîΩOne should cultivate the ultimate thought of awakening, which is the emptiness and compassion that are inseparable and are not taught by another as ultimately unborn.

original: don dam par skye ba med pa gzhan gyis bstan bya ma yin pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems bsgom par bya'o zhes pa 'di lta bu'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug par
analyzed: don dam par skye ba med pa gzhan gyis bstan bya ma yin pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems bsgom par bya'o zhes pa 'di lta bu'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug par
translated: In this way, one should enter the perfection of wisdom.

original: byed do zhes khyad par dang bcas pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed do zhes khyad par dang bcas pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is explained with a distinction.

original: de'i phyir pa rol tu phyin pa drug kyang sbyin pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir pa rol tu phyin pa drug kyang sbyin pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the six perfections should be called generosity.

original: gang 'phags pa thogs med kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa thogs med kyis gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said by the noble Asanga:

original: phar phyin drug kyang sbyin pa yi //
analyzed: phar phyin drug kyang sbyin pa yi //
translated: The six perfections are generosity,

original: zang zing mi 'jigs chos las te //üîΩgcig dang gnyis dang gsum gyis ni //
analyzed: zang zing mi 'jigs chos las te // gcig dang gnyis dang gsum gyis ni //
translated: From material things, from fearlessness, and from the Dharma.üîΩOne should not abide in that which is to be accomplished

original: bsgrub bya de la gnas mi bya //
analyzed: bsgrub bya de la gnas mi bya //
translated: By one, two, or three.

original: zhes so // tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni brjod zin zhing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes so // tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni brjod zin zhing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The three kinds of morality have been mentioned and will be explained.

original: bzod pa ni chos la nges par sems pa dang sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang pha rol gnod pa byed pa la ji snyam pa'i bdag nyid de rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bzod pa ni chos la nges par sems pa dang sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang pha rol gnod pa byed pa la ji snyam pa'i bdag nyid de rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Patience has three kinds: patience in withstanding pain, patience in accepting suffering, and patience in investigating the Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus kyang go cha dang dge ba dang sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i dbye ba las de ltar nyid do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang go cha dang dge ba dang sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i dbye ba las de ltar nyid do //
translated: Exertion has three kinds: armor-like exertion, exertion in applying oneself to virtue, and exertion in applying oneself to the welfare of living beings.

original: bsam gtan ni yon tan dang sems can gyi don dang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang bde ba mngon par sgrub pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni yon tan dang sems can gyi don dang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang bde ba mngon par sgrub pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Meditation has four kinds: meditation that accomplishes the welfare of living beings, meditation that accomplishes the counteragents to the addictions, meditation that accomplishes the special qualities of the transcendences, and meditation that accomplishes the happiness of living beings in this world.

original: yon tan ni mngon par shes pa dang 'phags pa dang lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yon tan ni mngon par shes pa dang 'phags pa dang lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The special qualities are the superknowledges, the noble qualities, the divine abodes, and so on.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos thams cad ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo can zhes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo can zhes so //
translated: All dharmas are the doors of samadhi.

original: 'phags pa'i gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid can te des rang dbang nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid can te des rang dbang nyid do //
translated: The noble abode is characterized by liberation from the defilements, and by it one has mastery over oneself.

original: lha'i gnas pa ni bsam gtan la sogs pa la gnas pa ste des sems dbang du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: lha'i gnas pa ni bsam gtan la sogs pa la gnas pa ste des sems dbang du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The divine abode is the abode in the absorptions, etc., and by it one has mastery over the mind.

original: bde ba ni bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu gnod pa med pa dang bde ba nye bar skye pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ni bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu gnod pa med pa dang bde ba nye bar skye pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Happiness is the result of the absorptions, because it is the absence of injury and the presence of bliss.

original: shes rab ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dang sems can gyi don mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i dbye ba las ram pa gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dang sems can gyi don mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i dbye ba las ram pa gsum mo //
translated: Wisdom is threefold, from the point of view of its differentiation as having as its object the conventional, the ultimate, and the whole range of what is to be known for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: byang chub kyi sems la brten pa nyid las rten dam pa nyid do //üîΩdngos po mtha' @95a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la brten pa nyid las rten dam pa nyid do //üîΩdngos po mtha' @95a * //
translated: It is the highest support, because it is based on the spirit of enlightenment.üîΩThe highest value is due to the fact that the transcendences are the cause of the highest value, Buddhahood.

original: dag la kun du spyod pa las dngos po dam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i dbang du byas pa nyid las ched du bya ba dam pa nyid dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba las thabs la mkhas pa dam pa nyid dang bla na med pa yang dag
analyzed: dag la kun du spyod pa las dngos po dam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i dbang du byas pa nyid las ched du bya ba dam pa nyid dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba las thabs la mkhas pa dam pa nyid dang bla na med pa yang dag
translated: The perfection of generosity is the highest skill in means, since it is embraced by nonconceptual wisdom.üîΩThe perfection of generosity is the highest dedication, since it is dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of generosity is the highest purity, since it is accomplished without the obscurations of affliction and the knowable.

original: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa nyid las yongs su bsngo ba dam pa nyid dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa med pa yang dag par 'grub pa las rnam par dag pa dam pa nyid de sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa so so rnams kyi mtshan nyid do zhes 'phags pa thogs med do //
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa nyid las yongs su bsngo ba dam pa nyid dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa med pa yang dag par 'grub pa las rnam par dag pa dam pa nyid de sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa so so rnams kyi mtshan nyid do zhes 'phags pa thogs med do //
translated: These are the characteristics of each perfection, generosity and so on, according to the noble Asanga.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pas longs spyod la mngon par dga' ba med de ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pas longs spyod la mngon par dga' ba med de ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus bodhisattvas have no attachment to enjoyments through generosity, because they are independent of them.

original: sbyin pa po 'di spyod la lta ba dang bral yang sbyin pas longs spyod mchog tu mang po dang bzang po nye bar gnas par byed cing 'di ni chos nyid yin te sems rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa po 'di spyod la lta ba dang bral yang sbyin pas longs spyod mchog tu mang po dang bzang po nye bar gnas par byed cing 'di ni chos nyid yin te sems rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is the nature of things: the giver, though lacking in conduct and insight, will have abundant and excellent resources through his generosity, because his mind is expansive.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag gi lus kyang ji ltar 'dod par longs //
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyang ji ltar 'dod par longs //
translated: Use my body as you wish,üîΩbut do not think of it as belonging to anyone else,

original: 'di la gzhan gyi blor yang ma byed cig / gang phyir 'di kun mkhyen rnams rang nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi blor yang ma byed cig / gang phyir 'di kun mkhyen rnams rang nyid kyi'o //
translated: for it is the property of all who know.

original: bdag la 'dir bdag mngon rlom ci yang med //
analyzed: bdag la 'dir bdag mngon rlom ci yang med //
translated: I have no pride in it at all.

original: ces pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gtong ba chen po la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: ces pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gtong ba chen po la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Thus the bodhisattva engages in great generosity.

original: de phyir thams cad nas ni skyon kun btang byas nas //
analyzed: de phyir thams cad nas ni skyon kun btang byas nas //
translated: Therefore, having given up all faults in every way,

original: byang chub don gnyer thams cad tshe na kun ster 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub don gnyer thams cad tshe na kun ster 'gyur /
translated: the one who strives for enlightenment should give everything at all times.

original: 'jig rten bskyab la gcig tu pad min sems gal //
analyzed: 'jig rten bskyab la gcig tu pad min sems gal //
translated: If you are not single-minded in protecting the world,

original: bya bas skye las spungs med 'di 'ang ga la nyid ;üîΩ/ ces so //
analyzed: bya bas skye las spungs med 'di 'ang ga la nyid ;üîΩ/ ces so //
translated: how can you be free of the heap of karma?

original: rgyal po'i rin po che'i phreng par ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i rin po che'i phreng par ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As the RatnƒÅvalƒ´ says:

original: gom pa bdun pa'i dus su yang //üîΩbdog pa kun gtong sems 'chang ba'i //
analyzed: gom pa bdun pa'i dus su yang // bdog pa kun gtong sems 'chang ba'i //
translated: Even at the time of the seventh step,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkha' lta bur //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkha' lta bur //
translated: the bodhisattva, who has the thought to give up everything,

original: dpag med bsod nams chu bo bskyed //
analyzed: dpag med bsod nams chu bo bskyed //
translated: generates an immeasurable river of meritüîΩlike the sky.

original: ces so // tshul khrims ni yang dag par blangs pas bslab pa rnams la shin du gus pa nyid do //
analyzed: ces so // tshul khrims ni yang dag par blangs pas bslab pa rnams la shin du gus pa nyid do //
translated: Morality is the utmost respect for the precepts through taking up the moral code.

original: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyi rim pa bzhin sems can dang sems can ma yin pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal dang dge ba la sbyor ba gnyis la mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyi rim pa bzhin sems can dang sems can ma yin pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal dang dge ba la sbyor ba gnyis la mi skyo ba'o //
translated: Patience and effort are the non-discouragement in the two, the application to the suffering created by sentient beings and non-sentient entities, respectively.

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab dag gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnal @95b 'byor zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab dag gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnal @95b 'byor zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang dag par bsdus so //
translated: DhyƒÅna and wisdom are the non-conceptual yoga, which is the combination of ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: 'di tsam yang theg pa chen po mtha' dag go //
analyzed: 'di tsam yang theg pa chen po mtha' dag go //
translated: This much is the entirety of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: de las pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum ni lhag pa tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: de las pha rol tu phyin pa dang po gsum ni lhag pa tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: Among those, the first three perfections are the higher training in morality.

original: bsam gtan lhag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: bsam gtan lhag pa'i sems so //
translated: The perfection of meditative absorption is the superior mind.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa'i shes rab bo ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag pa'i shes rab bo ;
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the superior wisdom.

original: / brtson 'grus na bslab pa gsum rnams su yang ste brtson 'grus thams cad kyi grogs yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: / brtson 'grus na bslab pa gsum rnams su yang ste brtson 'grus thams cad kyi grogs yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And the perfection of effort is in all three trainings, because effort is the companion of all perfections.

original: rgyu gsum gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi go rims bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi go rims bstan to //
translated: The order of generosity and so on is taught for three reasons.

original: snga ma la brten nas phyi ma skye ba'i phyir te gang gi phyir longs spyod la ltos pa med pa ni tshul khrims yang dag par len no //üîΩtshul khrims dang ldan pa ni bzod do //
analyzed: snga ma la brten nas phyi ma skye ba'i phyir te gang gi phyir longs spyod la ltos pa med pa ni tshul khrims yang dag par len no // tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni bzod do //
translated: The later perfections arise in dependence on the earlier ones, because those who are not concerned with wealth take up moral discipline,üîΩthose who possess moral discipline are patient,

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: those who are patient make an effort,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed do //
translated: those who make an effort generate meditative concentration,

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byed do //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byed do //
translated: and those whose minds are concentrated know reality as it is.

original: snga ma dman pa nyid kyi phyir dang phyi ma mchog nyid kyi phyir yang ste sbyin pa dman la tshul khrims mchog nas bsam gtan dman la shes rab mchog gi bar gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dman pa nyid kyi phyir dang phyi ma mchog nyid kyi phyir yang ste sbyin pa dman la tshul khrims mchog nas bsam gtan dman la shes rab mchog gi bar gyi phyir ro //
translated: Also, the former are inferior and the latter superior, because giving is inferior and morality superior, up to because meditative concentration is inferior and wisdom superior.

original: sngon ma rags la phyi ma phra ba nyid kyi phyir yang ste /
analyzed: sngon ma rags la phyi ma phra ba nyid kyi phyir yang ste /
translated: Also, the former are gross and the latter subtle.

original: sbyin pa ni rags te 'jug sla ba'i phyir dang bya bla ba'i phyir la tshul khrims ni phra ba ste bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni rags te 'jug sla ba'i phyir dang bya bla ba'i phyir la tshul khrims ni phra ba ste bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Giving is gross because it is easy to enter and is well known, while morality is subtle because it is difficult to practice.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi bar du'o //
translated: The same is true up to wisdom.

original: 'di rnams kyang rim pa bzhin /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang rim pa bzhin /
translated: These are respectivelyüîΩthe generosity of teaching, pure morality,üîΩpatience in not producing anger,

original: chos sbyin tshul khrims rnam dag dang // mi skye ba la bzod nyid dang // theg pa che la brtson 'grus rtsom //
analyzed: chos sbyin tshul khrims rnam dag dang // mi skye ba la bzod nyid dang // theg pa che la brtson 'grus rtsom //
translated: exertion in the Great Vehicle,üîΩabiding in the extremes with compassion,

original: mtha' la snying rje ldan gnas dang // shes rab pha rol phyin zhes pa ;
analyzed: mtha' la snying rje ldan gnas dang // shes rab pha rol phyin zhes pa ;
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThese are considered the chief practices

original: / blo ldan rnams kyi gtso bor 'dod //
analyzed: / blo ldan rnams kyi gtso bor 'dod //
translated: of the wise.

original: mtha' ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: The extreme is the fourth meditative concentration.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje gcod par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje gcod par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the Transcendent Lord has stated in the Diamond Cutter Sutra:üîΩSubhuti, suppose that as many rivers as there are

original: rab 'byor gang ga'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa de snyed kyi gang ga'i klung rnams su gyur la /üîΩgang ga'i klung de rnams kyi bye ma ji snyed pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams skyes pa'am bud med la la zhig kho nas rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su gang bar byas te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs
analyzed: rab 'byor gang ga'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa de snyed kyi gang ga'i klung rnams su gyur la / gang ga'i klung de rnams kyi bye ma ji snyed pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams skyes pa'am bud med la la zhig kho nas rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su gang bar byas te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs
translated: sands in the Ganges River were to become Ganges Rivers,

original: pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la phul la /üîΩgang yang theg pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las tha na @96a * //
analyzed: pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la phul la / gang yang theg pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las tha na @96a * //
translated: and suppose that some man or woman were to fill them with the seven precious substances and offer them to the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones.üîΩAnd suppose that someone, having taken even just a four-line verse from this Mahayana Dharma discourse, were to teach it to others.

original: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang bzung nas gzhan rnams la ston par byed na 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams mang du 'phel la tshad med cing grangs med do //
analyzed: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang bzung nas gzhan rnams la ston par byed na 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams mang du 'phel la tshad med cing grangs med do //
translated: The latter would have an infinitely greater merit than the former, and it would be incalculable.

original: gzhan yang gang du 'di las tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang ston pa'i sa phyogs de lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten mchod rten du gyur pa yin na gzung ba la sogs pa rnams la lta ci smos so zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang du 'di las tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang ston pa'i sa phyogs de lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten mchod rten du gyur pa yin na gzung ba la sogs pa rnams la lta ci smos so zhes so //
translated: Moreover, if the ground where even just a four-line verse of this is taught becomes a caitya for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, what need is there to mention the case of the scriptures and so on?

original: dper brjod pa gzhan yang mdo ji bzhin no //
analyzed: dper brjod pa gzhan yang mdo ji bzhin no //
translated: The other examples are just as in the sutra.

original: grangs drug ces rnam par gzhag pa ni mi 'phags pa'i rgyu longs spyod dang khyim la zhen pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ldog pa'i rgyu 'khor ba'i sems can gyi log sgrub las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal dang dus ring por dkar po'i phyogs la rab tu sbyor bas yongs su skyo ba'i gnyen por grangs ji lta bar bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mnyam pa'i
analyzed: grangs drug ces rnam par gzhag pa ni mi 'phags pa'i rgyu longs spyod dang khyim la zhen pa'i gnyen por go rims bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ldog pa'i rgyu 'khor ba'i sems can gyi log sgrub las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal dang dus ring por dkar po'i phyogs la rab tu sbyor bas yongs su skyo ba'i gnyen por grangs ji lta bar bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mnyam pa'i
translated: The six are presented as the antidotes to the causes of not being exalted: the perfections of generosity and morality are, respectively, the antidotes to attachment to wealth and to home life. The perfections of patience and effort are, respectively, the antidotes to the causes of turning back: the suffering that arises from the ingratitude of beings in cyclic existence and the weariness that comes from long-term commitment to virtue.

original: rgyu rnam par g-yeng ba dang shes rab 'chal pa'i gnyen por de bzhin du bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag go zhes pa de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa las so//
analyzed: rgyu rnam par g-yeng ba dang shes rab 'chal pa'i gnyen por de bzhin du bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag go zhes pa de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa las so//
translated: The perfections of meditative stabilization and wisdom are the antidotes to the causes of distraction and faulty wisdom, respectively.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtsa ba dang bcas pa spong ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtsa ba dang bcas pa spong ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom alone eliminates the discordances with the other perfections together with their roots.

original: shes rab ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul can nyid kyis thams cad du gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab ni de bzhin nyid kyi yul can nyid kyis thams cad du gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is the antidote to all because it is the subject that perceives suchness.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa med pa ni ser sna la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rgyu rtog pa sel bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa med pa ni ser sna la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rgyu rtog pa sel bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Generosity and so on that are not associated with the nonapprehension of the three spheres cannot eliminate the conceptions that are the causes of stinginess and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi mthu nyid kyis yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par rnams kyis pha rol tu 'gro ba la sbyar ba gnas su bcug pa nyid kyi phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams pha rol tu phyin par bstan pa thob kyis cig shos ltar
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi mthu nyid kyis yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par rnams kyis pha rol tu 'gro ba la sbyar ba gnas su bcug pa nyid kyi phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams pha rol tu phyin par bstan pa thob kyis cig shos ltar
translated: Therefore, by the power of wisdom itself, the distinctive dedications are applied to going beyond, and the perfections such as giving are taught to be perfections because they are established in the state of dedication.

original: na ma yin no //
analyzed: na ma yin no //
translated: They are not so for the other.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams gsum du dmigs pa yod na ni 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams zhes nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams gsum du dmigs pa yod na ni 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams zhes nye bar bstan to //
translated: If the perfections such as giving are observed as a triad, they are taught to be mundane perfections.

original: de bzhin du rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi rnams kyis rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa gcig @96b 'grub la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi rnams kyis rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa gcig @96b 'grub la /
translated: Similarly, by the four perfections that are the cause of nondistraction, the perfection of nondistraction is established.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba gang la brten nas chos kyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba rtogs pa las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par 'byung ngo zhes de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'byung ba'i gzhi'i gnas kyi phyir grangs rnam par gzhag go
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba gang la brten nas chos kyi de kho na nyid ji lta ba rtogs pa las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yang dag par 'byung ngo zhes de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'byung ba'i gzhi'i gnas kyi phyir grangs rnam par gzhag go
translated: The number is established as the basis for the arising of all the qualities of a Buddha, because it is the basis for the arising of all the qualities of a Buddha, in that the suchness of things is realized in dependence upon non-distraction, and from that realization the qualities of a Buddha arise.

original: // de bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi pha rol gyi 'bras bu gong du brjod la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyogs chen po dang 'khor chen po nyid do //
analyzed: // de bzhin du sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi pha rol gyi 'bras bu gong du brjod la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni phyogs chen po dang 'khor chen po nyid do //
translated: Thus, the results of the perfections of generosity and morality are stated above, and the perfection of patience is the greatness of the side and the greatness of the retinue.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i longs spyod la sogs pa mi chod pa nyid do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i longs spyod la sogs pa mi chod pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of effort is the non-interruption of enjoyment and so forth.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnod pa med pa'i lus skye ba ste 'bras bu gzhan yang gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnod pa med pa'i lus skye ba ste 'bras bu gzhan yang gsungs so //
translated: The perfection of concentration is the arising of a body that is not harmed. Other results are also stated.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang po rno ba nyid dang bde ba dang yid bde ba mang po nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang po rno ba nyid dang bde ba dang yid bde ba mang po nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the sharp faculty, and the abundance of happiness and mental pleasure.

original: skye bo'i tshogs chen po dbang du 'gyur ba yang ngo //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs chen po dbang du 'gyur ba yang ngo //
translated: The abundance of the great multitude of beings is the result.

original: mthong ba'i chos kyis ni 'di rnams thams cad kyi gzhi rab tu dang ba dang mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes 'bras bu las rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyis ni 'di rnams thams cad kyi gzhi rab tu dang ba dang mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes 'bras bu las rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The basis of all these is the faith of the disciple, and the nirvana in this life is the result.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gnod pa bzod pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gnod pa bzod pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Thus, the perfection of giving is the basis of the disciple, because it supports sentient beings. The perfection of morality is the basis, because it does not harm. The perfection of patience is the basis, because it endures harm.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bya ba mchog tu 'grub par byed pa'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par rung bar byas nas sems rnam par g-yeng ba rnams mnyam par gzhag pa'i ched du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bya ba mchog tu 'grub par byed pa'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par rung bar byas nas sems rnam par g-yeng ba rnams mnyam par gzhag pa'i ched du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: The perfection of wisdom instructs those who are ready for full maturity, having made them suitable for full maturity by means of the perfection of effort, which accomplishes the highest goal, for the sake of beings who are distracted in mind, by means of the perfection of concentration, and for the sake of those whose minds are concentrated, by means of the perfection of wisdom, for the sake of their liberation.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnams rnam par grol ba'i ched du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'doms pa'i phyir yongs su smin par byed pas de ltar sems can yongs su smin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir yang grangs rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnams rnam par grol ba'i ched du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'doms pa'i phyir yongs su smin par byed pas de ltar sems can yongs su smin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir yang grangs rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the number is also established in accordance with the full maturity of sentient beings.

original: snying rnges gdungs par gyur pas thabs su gyur pa sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams kyis rjes su bzung nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas de'i tshe nyid bde ba nye bar sdud pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas phyi mar bde ba nye bar sdud pa dang /
analyzed: snying rnges gdungs par gyur pas thabs su gyur pa sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams kyis rjes su bzung nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas de'i tshe nyid bde ba nye bar sdud pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas phyi mar bde ba nye bar sdud pa dang /
translated: concentration and wisdom, and thus he causes them to attain the end of happiness through the perfection of generosity, which is the attainment of happiness in this life, and the end of happiness through the perfection of ethics, which is the attainment of happiness in the next life.

original: sran tshugs pa dang spro ba dang sems rtse gcig pa'i mtha' gcig tu 'bras bu thob pa nye bar blangs nas bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus @97a * //
analyzed: sran tshugs pa dang spro ba dang sems rtse gcig pa'i mtha' gcig tu 'bras bu thob pa nye bar blangs nas bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus @97a * //
translated: He causes them to take up the result of one-pointedness of mind, which is the attainment of the end of patience, diligence,

original: dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis mtha' gcig tu bde ba nye bar sdud pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gtan du bde ba nye bar sdud pas bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas pa dang ldan pas de la yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis mtha' gcig tu bde ba nye bar sdud pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gtan du bde ba nye bar sdud pas bdag nyid pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas pa dang ldan pas de la yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang /
translated: concentration and wisdom, and thus he causes them to attain the end of happiness through the perfection of generosity, which is the attainment of happiness in this life, and the end of happiness through the perfection of ethics, which is the attainment of happiness in the next life.

original: 'dzud pa dang rab tu dgod pa rnams kyis tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'dzud pa dang rab tu dgod pa rnams kyis tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: And by means of introduction and full establishment, he brings the two collections to completion.

original: de la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa ste pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi cha shas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs te gzugs kyi sku'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa ste pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi cha shas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs te gzugs kyi sku'i rgyu'o //
translated: Of these, the collection of merit is the part of the three perfections of generosity, morality, and patience, and of the perfections of vigor and meditation, which is the cause of the form body.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i cha shas te chos kyi sku'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i cha shas te chos kyi sku'i rgyu'o //
translated: The collection of wisdom is the part of the perfection of wisdom and of the perfections of vigor and meditation, which is the cause of the truth body.

original: mdor bsdu na snying rjes las thams cad sems can gyi don nyid las bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na snying rjes las thams cad sems can gyi don nyid las bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: In brief, the collection of merit is the collection of all the bodhisattvas' activities, which are motivated by compassion and are for the sake of sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyis byang chub kyi don nyid kyi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis byang chub kyi don nyid kyi phyir ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of wisdom is the collection of all the bodhisattvas' activities, which are motivated by wisdom and are for the sake of enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnams re re la spyod pas kyang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnams re re la spyod pas kyang /
translated: Even if one practices only one of these perfections, such as generosity,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa sgrub par byed do zhes pa de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩde ltar yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga par gsungs pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa sgrub par byed do zhes pa de ltar khong du chud par bya'o // de ltar yang stong phrag nyi shu lnga par gsungs pa /
translated: And so on up to:üîΩThe perfection of giving is the accomplishment of the perfection of giving itself, and the perfection of morality is the accomplishment of the perfection of morality itself.üîΩThe perfection of patience is the accomplishment of the perfection of patience itself, and the perfection of effort is the accomplishment of the perfection of effort itself.üîΩThe perfection of meditation is the accomplishment of the perfection of meditation itself, and the perfection of wisdom is the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom itself.üîΩThe perfection of skill in means is the accomplishment of the six perfections themselves.

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa sbyin zhing sems can rnams la byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las nye bar gnas par 'gyur te 'di lta bu ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa sbyin zhing sems can rnams la byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las nye bar gnas par 'gyur te 'di lta bu ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of vow is the accomplishment of the six perfections themselves.üîΩThe perfection of power is the accomplishment of the six perfections themselves.üîΩThe perfection of knowledge is the accomplishment of the six perfections themselves.üîΩThe perfection of giving is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of morality is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of patience is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of effort is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.

original: de nyid kyi len pa po rnams gshe ba dang smod pa la sogs pa bzod pas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o /
analyzed: de nyid kyi len pa po rnams gshe ba dang smod pa la sogs pa bzod pas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o /
translated: The perfection of meditation is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of skill in means is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of vow is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of power is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of knowledge is the accomplishment of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe perfection of giving is the accomplishment of the ten powers of a Tathagata.üîΩThe perfection of morality is the accomplishment of the ten powers of a Tathagata.üîΩThe perfection of patience is the accomplishment of the ten powers of a Tathagata.üîΩThe perfection of effort is the accomplishment of the ten powers of a Tathagata.

original: de nyid kyi slong ba po khro ba dang mtshang 'bru ba la sogs pa rnams kyis sbyin pa la spro ba yongs su mi 'dor ba las brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi slong ba po khro ba dang mtshang 'bru ba la sogs pa rnams kyis sbyin pa la spro ba yongs su mi 'dor ba las brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the accomplishment of the ten powers of a Tathagata.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is the accomplishment of the ten powers of a Tathagata.üîΩThe perfection of skill in means is the accomplishment of the ten powers of a Tathagata.üîΩThe perfection of vow is the accomplishment of the ten powers of a Tathagata.üîΩThe

original: de nyid kyi sbyin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems med pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sbyin pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems med pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: That generosity is the perfection of meditation, because it is dedicated to omniscience and is not distracted by the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de nyid kyi sgyu ma'i blos nye bar gnas pas sbyin pa byin pa las su la yang phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa mi mthong ba las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sgyu ma'i blos nye bar gnas pas sbyin pa byin pa las su la yang phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa mi mthong ba las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes so //
translated: That generosity is the perfection of wisdom, because it is given with an illusory mind, and one does not see any benefit or harm to anyone.

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdor yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtsho'i mdor yang gsungs pa /
translated: The noble SƒÅgaramati S≈´tra also says,

original: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di ltar chos @97b bgrang ba la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyis gdungs pa bzod do //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di ltar chos @97b bgrang ba la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyis gdungs pa bzod do //
translated: ‚ÄúSƒÅgaramati, bodhisattvas who are engaged in enumerating phenomena can endure the torment of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te gang lus yongs su 'dor ba dang lus yongs su gtong ba dang lus la ltos pa med pa 'di ni 'di'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te gang lus yongs su 'dor ba dang lus yongs su gtong ba dang lus la ltos pa med pa 'di ni 'di'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: In the same way, giving up the body, giving away the body, and not being concerned with the body‚Äîthis is their perfection of generosity.

original: gang lus gcod pa na sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed pa dang tshor ba rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa 'di ni 'di'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang lus gcod pa na sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed pa dang tshor ba rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa 'di ni 'di'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality of the bodhisattva who is cutting off his body is the morality by which he pervades all sentient beings with love and is not carried away by feelings.

original: gang 'di'i lus gcod par byed pa de rnams nyid kyi thar pa'i don du bzod par byed cing sems kyis rma mi 'byin pa 'di ni 'di'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di'i lus gcod par byed pa de rnams nyid kyi thar pa'i don du bzod par byed cing sems kyis rma mi 'byin pa 'di ni 'di'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience of the bodhisattva who is cutting off his body is the patience by which he endures for the sake of the liberation of those who are cutting off his body and does not harbor ill will toward them.

original: brtson 'grus gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'dun pa de mi gtong zhing sems kyis stobs bskyed pa'ang rab tu 'dzin la 'khor ba'i rjes su 'brel par byed dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa nyid kyang rtsom pa 'di ni 'di'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'dun pa de mi gtong zhing sems kyis stobs bskyed pa'ang rab tu 'dzin la 'khor ba'i rjes su 'brel par byed dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa nyid kyang rtsom pa 'di ni 'di'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu
translated: The perfection of vigor of the bodhisattva who is cutting off his body is the vigor by which he does not abandon his aspiration for omniscience, by which he maintains the strength of mind, by which he continues to engage in the cycle of existence, and by which he continues to engage in the roots of virtue.

original: phyin pa'o // gang lus 'thor ba na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa rin po che mi gtong zhing byang chub nyid la lta bar byed zhi ba rab tu zhi ba nyid du so sor rtog pa 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyin pa'o // gang lus 'thor ba na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa rin po che mi gtong zhing byang chub nyid la lta bar byed zhi ba rab tu zhi ba nyid du so sor rtog pa 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: When the body is cut up, the fact that the mind of generation of the spirit of enlightenment for omniscience does not let go of the jewel and looks at enlightenment itself, and the individual investigation of peace and complete peace, this is the perfection of meditation.

original: gang lus gcod pa na lus sgyu ma'i chos nyid du 'jug pa 'di ni 'di'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang lus gcod pa na lus sgyu ma'i chos nyid du 'jug pa 'di ni 'di'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes so //
translated: When the body is cut up, the fact that the body is engaged in the reality of illusion, this is his perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di bzhin du tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / shes rab bsgom pa ji srid pa so sor pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pas yang dag par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di bzhin du tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / shes rab bsgom pa ji srid pa so sor pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pas yang dag par bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that the practice of morality and the cultivation of wisdom are subsumed by the completion of the six perfections individually.

original: 'di nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la go cha'i sgrub pa ste rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs par skad cig gcig pa mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la go cha'i sgrub pa ste rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs par skad cig gcig pa mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: This is also the armoring practice for the knowledge of all modes, the peak realization, the path of seeing in one instant.

original: de la rdzas su pha rol tu phyin pa drug po ming gis bcur 'gyur te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na khyad par gyi rnam par zhugs pa rnams thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par mngon parüîΩbrjod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rdzas su pha rol tu phyin pa drug po ming gis bcur 'gyur te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na khyad par gyi rnam par zhugs pa rnams thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par mngon par brjod par shes par bya'o //
translated: In substance, the six perfections are ten, by name, because the perfection of wisdom alone, when it enters into the special aspects, is declared to be the perfections of method, vow, power, and knowledge.üîΩThus, the perfection of method is the dedication of the roots of virtue collected by the six perfections to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ltar ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste thabs des de mi zad par byed pa'i
analyzed: de ltar ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste thabs des de mi zad par byed pa'i
translated: By that method, it makes that inexhaustible.

original: phyir ro // smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa grangs med pa ste /
analyzed: phyir ro // smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa grangs med pa ste /
translated: The perfection of vow is the ten great vows, etc., which are innumerable.

original: @98a * // gang gis skye ba so sor pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: @98a * // gang gis skye ba so sor pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'o //
translated: By them, one practices the six perfections in each lifetime.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgom pa'i stobs dang so sor rtog pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgom pa'i stobs dang so sor rtog pa'i stobs te /
translated: The perfection of power is the power of meditation and the power of discernment.

original: gang gis nyi ma so so 'am skad cig so sor de rnams la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis nyi ma so so 'am skad cig so sor de rnams la spyod pa'o //
translated: One practices them every day or every instant.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni theg pa chen po dgongs pa ji lta ba dang sgra ji lta bar yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni theg pa chen po dgongs pa ji lta ba dang sgra ji lta bar yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the knowledge of the Great Vehicle just as it is intended and just as it is expressed.

original: seng ge bzang po ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin zhes brjod pa ni shin tu bab chol te /
analyzed: seng ge bzang po ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin zhes brjod pa ni shin tu bab chol te /
translated: It is utter nonsense for Haribhadra to say that the perfection of knowledge is not nonconceptual.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid bcu bzhi pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bdun gyi ngo bo ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid bcu bzhi pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa bdun gyi ngo bo ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The essence of the seven generations of the Thought of Enlightenment beginning with the fourteenth perfection of wisdom is the perfection of knowledge.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa kho na yin pas der thams cad du rnam par rtog pa rnams kun du spyod pa cung zad kyang mi srid la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa kho na yin pas der thams cad du rnam par rtog pa rnams kun du spyod pa cung zad kyang mi srid la /
translated: Since conceptualization is the very defilement of the Bodhisattvas, it is absolutely impossible for them to engage in conceptualization at all.

original: mthar bag chags kyang ma lus par nub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar bag chags kyang ma lus par nub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because in the end, even the latent impressions are extinguished without remainder.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ga la yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ga la yin /
translated: Therefore, how could the pure [cognition] that is attained subsequent to supramundane wisdom be a conceptual cognition of the world?

original: dag pa nyid kyang ci zhe na gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: dag pa nyid kyang ci zhe na gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa med pa yin la /
translated: What is pure? It is the absence of the adherence to apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta ma yi na te 'di ni rang nyid ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa dang gang las rang gi rnam pa la phyi rol gyi ngo bor sgro btags nas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta ma yi na te 'di ni rang nyid ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa dang gang las rang gi rnam pa la phyi rol gyi ngo bor sgro btags nas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: But conceptualization is not like that. It is itself the nature of ignorance, and it engages by superimposing external entities onto its own aspects.

original: sgro 'dogs pa ma yin na'ang ci ltar 'di rnam par rtag pa yin zhes shing rta chen po rnams kyis nges par dpyad do //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa ma yin na'ang ci ltar 'di rnam par rtag pa yin zhes shing rta chen po rnams kyis nges par dpyad do //
translated: If it is not superimposition, then how is it conceptual? This has been ascertained by the great charioteers.

original: gal te rnam par mi rtog pa la rang bzhin pa'i bya ba dang 'bras bu la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gal te rnam par mi rtog pa la rang bzhin pa'i bya ba dang 'bras bu la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: If [you say that] non-conceptuality is due to the absence of conceptualization regarding the nature of action and effect,

original: / de tshe bya ba la 'jug pa med de de ni rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: / de tshe bya ba la 'jug pa med de de ni rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But at that time there is no engagement in action, because that is associated with discursive thought.

original: skyon med de shing gi rang bzhin gyi skyes pa dang bud med kyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du yod pa tsam las der rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: brnab sems ni kye ma ma la pha rol po rnams kyi gang yin pa de dag gir gyur na zhes pha rol gyi rdzas dang longs spyod rnams sam bud med rnams la chags pa 'dzin pa'i nges pa ste /
translated: Covetousness is the determination to possess the wealth and possessions of others or the women of others, thinking, Alas, if only the wealth and possessions of others were mine or if only the women of others were mine.

original: yan lag lnga ni pha rol gyi rdzas dang der 'du shes pa dang der rtog pa dang 'dzin pa rab tu 'jug pa dang 'dzin par nges pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga ni pha rol gyi rdzas dang der 'du shes pa dang der rtog pa dang 'dzin pa rab tu 'jug pa dang 'dzin par nges pa'o //
translated: The five branches are the wealth of others, the recognition of that, the thought of it as one‚Äôs own, the engagement in possessing it and the determination to possess it.

original: gnod sems ni sems can pha rol po rnams la zhe sdang ba sems can 'di rnams la 'tshe bar bya'o zhes @102a * //
analyzed: gnod sems ni sems can pha rol po rnams la zhe sdang ba sems can 'di rnams la 'tshe bar bya'o zhes @102a * //
translated: Malice is the hatred of sentient beings, thinking, I will harm these sentient beings.

original: gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ste yan lag lnga ni sdang bya dang der 'du shes pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang zhe sdang rab tu 'dzin pa dang zhe sdang ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ste yan lag lnga ni sdang bya dang der 'du shes pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang zhe sdang rab tu 'dzin pa dang zhe sdang ba'o //
translated: The five branches are the object to be harmed, the recognition of that, the disturbance of the mind, the engagement in harming and the harm itself.

original: log par lta ba na rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bya ba dang yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba na rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bya ba dang yod pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: Wrong view is the view that denies cause, effect, action and existent things.

original: yan lag lnga ni skur ba gdab bya dang der 'du shes pa dang skur pa 'debs par 'dod pa dang skur pa 'debs par yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / skur pa 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga ni skur ba gdab bya dang der 'du shes pa dang skur pa 'debs par 'dod pa dang skur pa 'debs par yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / skur pa 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: The five members are: the object of the false imputation, the perception of that, the desire to falsely impute, the apprehension of the false imputation, and the one who falsely imputes.

original: lta ba ni 'dir nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab ste gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yang dag par gcod cing mi dge ba la 'jug la dge ba rnams la ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni 'dir nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab ste gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yang dag par gcod cing mi dge ba la 'jug la dge ba rnams la ma yin pa'o //
translated: View is the afflicted understanding, by which one severs the roots of virtue, engages in nonvirtue, and does not engage in virtue.

original: gang de las gzhan pa log par lta ba theg pa gzhan la sogs par lta ba'i mtshan nyid can de thams cad ni log par kun du rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gang de las gzhan pa log par lta ba theg pa gzhan la sogs par lta ba'i mtshan nyid can de thams cad ni log par kun du rtog pa ste /
translated: All wrong views other than that, such as the view of other vehicles, are wrong imagination.

original: des dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes pa yid kyi las kyi lam gsum mo //
analyzed: des dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes pa yid kyi las kyi lam gsum mo //
translated: By that, one does not sever the roots of virtue. These are the three mental karmic paths.

original: kha cig gsum po 'di rnams bsam pa kho na'i khyad par las rig par bya la gnod sems ni dmigs pa'i khyad par las kyang 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig gsum po 'di rnams bsam pa kho na'i khyad par las rig par bya la gnod sems ni dmigs pa'i khyad par las kyang 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that these three should be known only from the specific intention, but malice is asserted also from the specific focal object.

original: mi dge bcu po 'di rnams la so sor 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: mi dge bcu po 'di rnams la so sor 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: One engages in each of these ten nonvirtuous actions through attachment, hatred, and delusion.üîΩKilling arises from delusion, because those who are deluded about the Dharma kill sacrificial animals, kings kill evildoers, and the Parsig people kill their mothers and fathers.

original: gang gi phyir srog gcod pa gti mug las skyes pa yod de chos kyi blos mchod sbyin byed pa rnams phyugs gsod pa dang rgyal po rnams ma rungs pa gsod pa dang sog po par sig pa rnams ma dang pha gsod pa dang / de bzhin du zas med par 'jog pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog gcod pa gti mug las skyes pa yod de chos kyi blos mchod sbyin byed pa rnams phyugs gsod pa dang rgyal po rnams ma rungs pa gsod pa dang sog po par sig pa rnams ma dang pha gsod pa dang / de bzhin du zas med par 'jog pa dang /
translated: Similarly, some people kill those who are without food,

original: dge slong gsod pa dang / 'ga' zhig sbrul la sogs pa dang ri dag sa la sogs pa gsod pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong gsod pa dang / 'ga' zhig sbrul la sogs pa dang ri dag sa la sogs pa gsod pa ste /

original: sbrul dang sdig pa dang tam pa ka la sogs pa mi rnams la nye bar 'tshe bar byed pa rnams gsod par bya'o //
analyzed: sbrul dang sdig pa dang tam pa ka la sogs pa mi rnams la nye bar 'tshe bar byed pa rnams gsod par bya'o //
translated: Snakes, scorpions, centipedes and so on harm humans and should be killed.üîΩDeer, cattle, birds, fish and so on are killed for the sake of enjoyment.

original: ri dags dang phyugs dang bya dang nya la sogs pa rnams longs spyod kyi don du'o zhes log par lta bas 'jug pa thams cad gti mug las skyes pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ri dags dang phyugs dang bya dang nya la sogs pa rnams longs spyod kyi don du'o zhes log par lta bas 'jug pa thams cad gti mug las skyes pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: All engagement through wrong view is preparation arising from delusion.

original: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa la ste 'dir gti mug las skyes pa'i sbyor ba ni chos kyi blos rgyal po rnams ma rung sa pa tshar gcad pa'i don du dang / bram ze rnams kyang 'di thams cad tshangs pa bram ze rnams la byin pa la dmangs rnams sto bas kyis yongs su longs spyod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma byin par len pa la ste 'dir gti mug las skyes pa'i sbyor ba ni chos kyi blos rgyal po rnams ma rung sa pa tshar gcad pa'i don du dang / bram ze rnams kyang 'di thams cad tshangs pa bram ze rnams la byin pa la dmangs rnams sto bas kyis yongs su longs spyod de /
translated: Here, the preparation arising from delusion is the thought of Dharma of kings who kill those who are not kings for the sake of subduing them and the thought of Dharma of brahmins who say, ‚ÄúAll this was given to brahmins by BrahmƒÅ and is enjoyed by the low caste because of their greed.‚Äù

translated: Thus, for those who say, ‚ÄúBrahmins take what is theirs,‚Äù there is no thought of others or of themselves.

analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pas log par spyod pa'i sbyor ba gsum las skyes pa ste /

original: gti mug las skyes pa ni chos kyi blos sog po par sig pa rnams ma la bgrod pa dang bram ze rnams kyi ba lang byin gyi mchod sbyin la gang 'di skad smra ba ste /

translated: That arising from delusion is the thought of Dharma of the ≈öavara and PƒÅ≈õupata who say that it is permissible to have sex with one‚Äôs mother, sister, and so on and the thought of Dharma of brahmins who say that it is permissible to have sex with the cow of the sacrifice of the bull of brahmins.

original: bram zes ba lang byin gyi mchod sbyin byas nas lo gcig gis ba lang gi brtul zhugs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram zes ba lang byin gyi mchod sbyin byas nas lo gcig gis ba lang gi brtul zhugs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The Brahmins, who are devoted to the sacrifice of the gift of cows, say that by giving a cow to a Brahmin, one obtains heaven.

original: cho ga can gyis chu btung ngo rtsva rnams gcod do //
analyzed: cho ga can gyis chu btung ngo rtsva rnams gcod do //
translated: The followers of the ritual say that one should drink water, cut grass,
