analyzed: ma dang nye bar 'gro'o //

analyzed: sring mo dang nye ba dang rigs gcig pa dang nye bar 'gro ste / de ltar glang bu 'di 'jig rten las rgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba dang 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa rnams kyang ma la bgrod pa ni /
translated: go to one's sister, go to one's cousin.üîΩIn this way, the calf will conquer the world.

original: gtun dang me tog dang 'bras bu dang zas tshos pa dang 'jug dogs dang lam dang 'dra'o zhes te /
analyzed: gtun dang me tog dang 'bras bu dang zas tshos pa dang 'jug dogs dang lam dang 'dra'o zhes te /

analyzed: 'dir chos ma yin pa cung zad kyang med do zhes 'jug pa'o //

original: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba'i sbyor ba ste /

analyzed: gti mug las skyes pa ni skyon ma mthong ba las te /

original: de bzhin bram ze rnams bud med rnams la dang bag ma len pa'i dus dang srog dang nor srung ba'i don du brdzun du smra ba ni ltung ba med do zhes smra ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bram ze rnams bud med rnams la dang bag ma len pa'i dus dang srog dang nor srung ba'i don du brdzun du smra ba ni ltung ba med do zhes smra ba lta bu'o //
translated: Likewise, Brahmins say that it is not a downfall for women to lie in order to protect their lives and wealth, and in order to receive a brideprice.

original: de bzhin du dngos gzhi dang 'jug kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos gzhi dang 'jug kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams kyis so //
translated: Likewise, the actual basis and the conclusion are motivated by attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug sngon du song bas sbyor bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug sngon du song bas sbyor bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand that the other nonvirtuous actions are also motivated by attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: phra ma'i sbyor ba gti mug las skyes pa ni phra ma byas pa la nyes ba ci yang med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phra ma'i sbyor ba gti mug las skyes pa ni phra ma byas pa la nyes ba ci yang med do zhes pa'o //

original: de la byed par 'dod pa'i rjes su de la bya ba gang yang rung ba cung zad de ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de la byed par 'dod pa'i rjes su de la bya ba gang yang rung ba cung zad de ni sbyor ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The state of preparation is any slight action that is done in accordance with the wish to commit a particular nonvirtuous action.

original: sbyor ba des de'i tshe'am dus gzhan du las de yongs su rdzogs pa ni mthar thug par byed pa'i bdag nyid dngos gzhi'i las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: sbyor ba des de'i tshe'am dus gzhan du las de yongs su rdzogs pa ni mthar thug par byed pa'i bdag nyid dngos gzhi'i las kyi lam mo //
translated: The action of that at the time of that or at another time, the completion of that action, is the actual path of action that has the nature of bringing it to completion.

original: de'i rjes su gang rjes su sgrogs pa dang gang yang dag par dga' ba dang gang yang gzhan de dang mthun pa'i bya ba de ni rjes so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su gang rjes su sgrogs pa dang gang yang dag par dga' ba dang gang yang gzhan de dang mthun pa'i bya ba de ni rjes so //
translated: Subsequent is that which is proclaimed subsequently, that which is delighted in, and that which is done in accordance with that.

original: 'o na yid kyi brnab sems la sogs pa rnams la bsam pa ni ci sbyor ba ni ci ste bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yid kyi brnab sems la sogs pa rnams la bsam pa ni ci sbyor ba ni ci ste bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is the intention and what is the preparation in the case of mental covetousness and so on, since there is no distinction?

original: de'i gzhi la de ltar 'du shes pa dang de ltar 'dod pa ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi la de ltar 'du shes pa dang de ltar 'dod pa ni bsam pa'o //

analyzed: de'i bya ba yang dag par 'dzin pa ni sbyor ba'o //

original: de lta nyid du nges pa ni mthar thugs par byed pa'i las kyi lam mo zhes pa bye brag yod @103a * //
analyzed: de lta nyid du nges pa ni mthar thugs par byed pa'i las kyi lam mo zhes pa bye brag yod @103a * //

original: do ; / mi dge bcu'i las kyi lam 'di rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba ste ltung ba ni 'da' ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de lta mod kyi dge ba'i bsam pa can gyi dge ba'i rkyen gyi dbang 'ba' zhig las rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen de dang de las /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi dge ba'i bsam pa can gyi dge ba'i rkyen gyi dbang 'ba' zhig las rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen de dang de las /

original: de dang der ji ltar nye bar bstan pa las 'da' ba dang / snying rje can sems can rnams la byams pa las phan par 'dod pa dang / rnam par drang bar 'dod pa dang 'dul bar 'dod pa nyid kyis 'da' ba ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de dang der ji ltar nye bar bstan pa las 'da' ba dang / snying rje can sems can rnams la byams pa las phan par 'dod pa dang / rnam par drang bar 'dod pa dang 'dul bar 'dod pa nyid kyis 'da' ba ni ltung ba med do //
translated: For the compassionate one, who has love for sentient beings, who wishes to benefit them, who wishes to guide them, and who wishes to discipline them, there is no downfall in transgressing the rules.

original: las ni rnam pa gnyis te kun nas bslang bar bya ba dang kun nas slong ba po'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: las ni rnam pa gnyis te kun nas bslang bar bya ba dang kun nas slong ba po'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Action is twofold, in terms of the distinction between that which is to be instigated and that which instigates.

original: de la lus dang ngag gi las thams cad kun nas bslang bar bya ba ste yid kyi ni kun nas slong ba po'o //
analyzed: de la lus dang ngag gi las thams cad kun nas bslang bar bya ba ste yid kyi ni kun nas slong ba po'o //

analyzed: thabs la mkhas par yang /

original: smad 'tshong ma bzhin du don byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ltos pa med pa ni sems can de gtong ngo //
analyzed: smad 'tshong ma bzhin du don byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ltos pa med pa ni sems can de gtong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva who has done his duty like a prostitute, without regard, gives up on that sentient being.

original: sa ma thob pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa 'di bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: sa ma thob pas kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa 'di bsam par bya ste /
translated: Even one who has not attained the stages should think about this, who is endowed with the practice of the six perfections.

original: cig shos kyi ma yin no zhes pa zhar la 'ongs pa de tsam ste gzhag go //
analyzed: cig shos kyi ma yin no zhes pa zhar la 'ongs pa de tsam ste gzhag go //
translated: This is the extent of the digression: the rest is to be set aside.

original: de'i phyir zhe sdang gi skabs sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhe sdang gi skabs sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not give way to anger.

original: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus par gsungs pa /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor gyis zhus par gsungs pa /
translated: The Udayana-pariprccha declares:

original: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kha na ma thob @105b chen po dang bcas pa'i ltung ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi kha na ma thob @105b chen po dang bcas pa'i ltung ba ni gnyis te /
translated: ‚Äú Sariputra, there are two downfalls of bodhisattvas that involve a great offense.

original: gang dag ce na zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang gti mug dang ldan pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: gang dag ce na zhe sdang dang ldan pa dang gti mug dang ldan pa'o zhes so //
translated: What are they? Those that are associated with anger and those that are associated with delusion.

original: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rang gi srog gi phyir yang shes bzhin du brdzun du mi smra ba de pha rol po rnams gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa grol ba'i don du zang zing la mi lta ba thugs brtse ba nyid kyis brdzun du smra
analyzed: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' rang gi srog gi phyir yang shes bzhin du brdzun du mi smra ba de pha rol po rnams gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa grol ba'i don du zang zing la mi lta ba thugs brtse ba nyid kyis brdzun du smra
translated: Also, when a bodhisattva, even for the sake of his life, does not lie, then, in order to liberate others from being killed, bound and so on, he speaks lies out of compassion and without regard for material things.

original: ba ni ltung ba med par 'gyur te bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o //üîΩsdig pa'i grogs po dang 'brel pa'i sems can rnams de dag dbye ba'i ched du phra mo spyad pa yang ltung ba med de bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: ba ni ltung ba med par 'gyur te bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o // sdig pa'i grogs po dang 'brel pa'i sems can rnams de dag dbye ba'i ched du phra mo spyad pa yang ltung ba med de bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o //
translated: That is not a downfall, and he generates much merit.üîΩAlso, when a bodhisattva uses slander in order to separate sentient beings from their evil companions, that is not a downfall, and he generates much merit.

original: lam log pa la spyod pa rnams de las bzlog pa'i ched du yang yang tshig rtsub po smra ba yang ltung ba med de bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o /
analyzed: lam log pa la spyod pa rnams de las bzlog pa'i ched du yang yang tshig rtsub po smra ba yang ltung ba med de bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o /
translated: Also, when a bodhisattva uses harsh words again and again in order to turn people away from the wrong path, that is not a downfall, and he generates much merit.

original: gar dang glu dang rol mo dang smad 'tshong ma dang bza' ba dang btung ba dang rgyal po dang chom rkun pa la sogs pa'i gtam la mos pa rnams de rnams kyi gtam gyis drangs nas dge ba la rab tu zhugs pa'i don du rnam pa sna tshogs
analyzed: gar dang glu dang rol mo dang smad 'tshong ma dang bza' ba dang btung ba dang rgyal po dang chom rkun pa la sogs pa'i gtam la mos pa rnams de rnams kyi gtam gyis drangs nas dge ba la rab tu zhugs pa'i don du rnam pa sna tshogs
translated: When those who are interested in dance, song, music, prostitutes, food, drink, kings, thieves, and so on are attracted by such topics, the bodhisattva speaks to them in various ways about irrelevant topics in order to engage them in virtue.

original: pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i gtam byas kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur la bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i gtam byas kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur la bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o //
translated: Even though he speaks in this way, he does not fall into error and much merit is generated.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba'i las rnams byas kyang byang chub sems dpa' la mi dge ba med cing bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye na bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams lta ci smos //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba'i las rnams byas kyang byang chub sems dpa' la mi dge ba med cing bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye na bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams lta ci smos //
translated: Thus, even though he performs actions that are naturally reprehensible, the bodhisattva does not generate demerit but rather much merit. What need is there to mention his avoidance of reprehensible actions that are proscribed?

original: de lta mod kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byis pa rnams rjes su bsrung ba'i don du 'di lta bu kun du spyad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byis pa rnams rjes su bsrung ba'i don du 'di lta bu kun du spyad par mi bya ste /
translated: Nevertheless, bodhisattvas should not engage in such conduct, even though it is permitted, in order to protect the immature from being corrupted.

original: gang gi phyir byis pa rang gis de srid du bag la nyal ma spangs pa rnams pha rol snying rje bas 'jug pa la ltung ba med cing bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o zhes brtag pa phra mo tsam bzung nas de dang de spyod pa rgyun
analyzed: gang gi phyir byis pa rang gis de srid du bag la nyal ma spangs pa rnams pha rol snying rje bas 'jug pa la ltung ba med cing bsod nams mang po yang rab tu skye'o zhes brtag pa phra mo tsam bzung nas de dang de spyod pa rgyun
translated: Because the childish, not having abandoned those latencies, are without fault in engaging in those things out of compassion for others. And they generate much merit.

original: du 'byung ba rnams ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: du 'byung ba rnams ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: But those who, having grasped at just a slight analysis, continue to engage in those things, will go to miserable realms.

original: bstan pa 'di la yang mi gus par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la yang mi gus par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: And they will also be disrespectful to this teaching.

original: de ltar ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams bdag gi dngos po dang longs spyod dang phyi rol gyi dngos po rgud pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams bdag gi dngos po dang longs spyod dang phyi rol gyi dngos po rgud pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Thus the ten unwholesome courses of action are the cause of the decline of one's person, enjoyments, and external things.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs kyi bu rnams mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu rnams chen por snang bas dmyal ba rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rnams mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu rnams chen por snang bas dmyal ba rnams su skye'o //
translated: Sons of noble family, those who have the ten unwholesome courses of action in a great form are born among the hell beings.

original: 'bring gis dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'bring gis dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams su'o //
translated: By a middling form, among the animals.

original: chung ngus yi dags rnams su ste /
analyzed: chung ngus yi dags rnams su ste /
translated: By a small form, among the ghosts.

original: de ni 'di @106a * //
analyzed: de ni 'di @106a * //
translated: That is this.

original: rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩde gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid du 'ongs na go rims ji lta bar bcu po rnams kyis tshe thung ba dang longs spyod kyis phongs pa dang 'gran zla dang bcas pa'i chung ma dang skur pa mang ba dang 'di'i grogs po dbye bar
analyzed: rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o // de gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid du 'ongs na go rims ji lta bar bcu po rnams kyis tshe thung ba dang longs spyod kyis phongs pa dang 'gran zla dang bcas pa'i chung ma dang skur pa mang ba dang 'di'i grogs po dbye bar
translated: These are the maturational results of the ten nonvirtues.üîΩIf one comes to the human realm through the power of karma, one will have a short life due to killing, lack resources due to stealing, have a quarrelsome wife due to sexual misconduct, have many slanderers due to lying, have many friends who deceive one due to divisive speech, hear unpleasant sounds due to harsh speech, have many disputes with friends due to idle talk, have an unattractive body due to covetousness, have a body with many diseases due to ill will, and have a body with many afflictions due to wrong view.

original: 'gyur ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos pa dang ngag gzung bar mi 'os pa dang 'dod chags drag pa dang zhe sdang drag pa dang gti mug drag pa'o zhes pa 'di ni 'di rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos pa dang ngag gzung bar mi 'os pa dang 'dod chags drag pa dang zhe sdang drag pa dang gti mug drag pa'o zhes pa 'di ni 'di rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: These are the results of natural outflow of the ten nonvirtues.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams mdangs chung bar 'gyur ba dang lo dgra mang ba dang rdul gyis gang ba dang dri nga ba dang mthon dman can dang / tshva sgo can dang dgon dung can dang tha ba can dang sdig pa can gyi sa dang dus tshigs 'gyur ba mi mnyam pa dang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams mdangs chung bar 'gyur ba dang lo dgra mang ba dang rdul gyis gang ba dang dri nga ba dang mthon dman can dang / tshva sgo can dang dgon dung can dang tha ba can dang sdig pa can gyi sa dang dus tshigs 'gyur ba mi mnyam pa dang /
translated: External things have little luster, many crop-destroying forces, are filled with dust, have bad smells, are uneven, salty, arid, and have poor soil. The seasons change irregularly.

original: 'bras bu phra ba dang 'bras bu mi zhim pa dang 'bras bu nyung ba'o zhes pa 'di ni 'di rnams kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu phra ba dang 'bras bu mi zhim pa dang 'bras bu nyung ba'o zhes pa 'di ni 'di rnams kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The fruits are small, have bad taste, and are few. This is the dominant result of these actions.

original: de bzhin du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams bstan pas lha rnams su skye'o zhes pa 'di ni 'di rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams bstan pas lha rnams su skye'o zhes pa 'di ni 'di rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Similarly, it is said that by teaching the ten wholesome courses of action one is reborn as a god. This is the maturational result of these actions.

original: de gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs na bcu po rnams kyi go rims bzhin tshe thung ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa bcur 'gyur ba 'di ni 'di rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs na bcu po rnams kyi go rims bzhin tshe thung ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa bcur 'gyur ba 'di ni 'di rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: If one comes to the human realm, one obtains the opposite of the ten results of the ten nonvirtuous actions, such as a long life. This is the result of natural outflow of these actions.

original: gzi mdangs chung ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa bcur yang 'gyur ba 'di ni 'di rnams kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gzi mdangs chung ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa bcur yang 'gyur ba 'di ni 'di rnams kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The opposite of these ten, such as having great splendor, are the dominant results.

original: rnam par grol ba gsum gyi rgyu yang 'di rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba gsum gyi rgyu yang 'di rnams te /
translated: These are also the causes of the three liberations.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: lag 'gro'i bdag po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di rnams ni lha dang mir skye ba'i rten no ;
analyzed: lag 'gro'i bdag po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di rnams ni lha dang mir skye ba'i rten no ;
translated: O lord of the demigods, these ten paths of virtuous action are the basis for rebirth as a god or human,

original: / slob pa dang mi slob pa thob pa dang rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang ji srid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rnams kyi bar gyi rten no zhes so //
analyzed: / slob pa dang mi slob pa thob pa dang rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang ji srid sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rnams kyi bar gyi rten no zhes so //
translated: the basis for attaining the state of a learner and nonlearner, for the state of a solitary realizer, for all the bodhisattva deeds, and for all the qualities of a buddha.

original: 'o na chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu yin na /
analyzed: 'o na chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bu yin na /
translated: If all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, like dreams and illusions,

original: de'i phyir las dang de'i 'bras bu yod do zhes rnam par gzhag pa ga la 'thad ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang de'i 'bras bu yod do zhes rnam par gzhag pa ga la 'thad ce na /
translated: how can it be tenable to posit the existence of karma and its results?

original: de ltar ma yin te sems can rnams kyis chos rnams rang bzhin stong par ma shes la mi shes pa gang zag dang chos su rtog par byed pa rnams legs par spyod pa'am nyes par spyod pa'i las mngon par 'du byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te sems can rnams kyis chos rnams rang bzhin stong par ma shes la mi shes pa gang zag dang chos su rtog par byed pa rnams legs par spyod pa'am nyes par spyod pa'i las mngon par 'du byed cing /
translated: They engage in virtuous or nonvirtuous actions.

original: @106b nyes par spyod pas ngan song gsum du ltung la legs par spyod pa rnams kyis lha dang mi rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: @106b nyes par spyod pas ngan song gsum du ltung la legs par spyod pa rnams kyis lha dang mi rnams su skye'o //
translated: Through nonvirtuous actions, they fall into the three lower realms. Through virtuous actions, they are born as gods and humans.

original: yang 'ga' zhig gang zag gi bdag med pa nyid du yongs su shes nas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro spangs te mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed do //
analyzed: yang 'ga' zhig gang zag gi bdag med pa nyid du yongs su shes nas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro spangs te mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed do //
translated: Moreover, some, having fully understood the selflessness of persons, abandon the happy and miserable realms and attain nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pas rim gyis sa bcu bgrod de skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad mngon par byang chub nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pas rim gyis sa bcu bgrod de skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad mngon par byang chub nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan
translated: Bodhisattvas complete the virtuous dharmas such as the perfections. They gradually traverse the ten grounds. With the wisdom of a single instant, they fully awaken to all dharmas and become buddhas.

original: 'das su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das su 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be past.üîΩ

original: de lta mod kyi chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid yin na mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa rnams med de rmi lam gyi gnas skabs bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid yin na mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa rnams med de rmi lam gyi gnas skabs bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if all phenomena are like dreams, then the ten nonvirtues and so on would not exist, and just as in the dream state, they would also exist in the waking state.

original: ma yin te ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i lugs la skad cig ma nyid kyis rgyu med par 'jig pa yin pa na dang grub pa'i mtha' las kyang /
analyzed: ma yin te ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i lugs la skad cig ma nyid kyis rgyu med par 'jig pa yin pa na dang grub pa'i mtha' las kyang /
translated: This is not so. In the system of the proponents of external objects, because of momentariness, things disintegrate without a cause, and also because of the tenets of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas,

original: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las skyes //
analyzed: 'jig rten sna tshogs las las skyes //
translated: the various worlds arise from karma.

original: zhes pa'i phyir don dam par sus kyang su yang bsad pa yang med de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i phyir don dam par sus kyang su yang bsad pa yang med de /
translated: Therefore, ultimately no one is killed by anyone,üîΩand no one takes the wealth of anyone.

original: sus kyang su'i nor blangs pa yang med ces pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa la rgyun 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i dngos po bskyed pa la gsod pa la sogs par rtog pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: sus kyang su'i nor blangs pa yang med ces pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa la rgyun 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i dngos po bskyed pa la gsod pa la sogs par rtog pa'i sgo nas /
translated: This contradicts the SautrƒÅntika assertion that things are produced from causes.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa las mi dge ba la sogs pa bzhin du srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams sad pa la rnam par gzhag pa de ltar rmi lam na yang dge ba dang mi dge ba bsags
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa las mi dge ba la sogs pa bzhin du srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams sad pa la rnam par gzhag pa de ltar rmi lam na yang dge ba dang mi dge ba bsags
translated: Just as nonvirtue and so on arise from the presence of improper mental activity and so on, so too killing and so on are posited as awakened from the presence of the sleep of ignorance.

original: pa'i gnas skabs su ae ma bsad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yongs su gsos pas yongs su gsos pas yongs su rgyas pa 'thob pa de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don du smra
analyzed: pa'i gnas skabs su ae ma bsad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la sogs par mngon par zhen pa yongs su gsos pas yongs su gsos pas yongs su rgyas pa 'thob pa de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don du smra
translated: In the same way, even in dreams, when there is the presence of virtue and nonvirtue, the activation of the latent propensities of the conception of ‚ÄúI killed‚Äù and so on is refreshed, and thus the full development of the propensities is obtained.

original: ba'i lugs kyis kyang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs bzhin zhes pa'i dpe ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i lugs kyis kyang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs bzhin zhes pa'i dpe ma grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, even according to the system of the proponents of external reality, the example of the dream state is not established.

original: de'i phyir dbu ma pa'i lugs kyis sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbu ma pa'i lugs kyis sad pa'i gnas skabs su yang /
translated: Therefore, according to the Madhyamaka system, even in the waking state,

original: dngos po rmi lam dang 'du ba de las dang rjes su mthun pa'i don dngos po la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pas phyin ci log gi 'ching ba mtha' dag ma nyams pa rnams la dge ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dngos po rmi lam dang 'du ba de las dang rjes su mthun pa'i don dngos po la sogs pa'i mngon par zhen pas phyin ci log gi 'ching ba mtha' dag ma nyams pa rnams la dge ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and the things and events of the dream are the objects that are consistent with the karma.  The entire bondage of error is undiminished for those who are attached to the reality of things and events.  Thus, virtue and so on are posited.

original: 'on kyang gnyid ma thug po'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid kyis mi gsal ba dang 'khrug par @107a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyid ma thug po'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid kyis mi gsal ba dang 'khrug par @107a * //
translated: However, because the cause of error is not strong in the dream state, the dream is not as clear and is more disturbed.

original: bsgrub pas rmi lam na 'bras bu smin la /
analyzed: bsgrub pas rmi lam na 'bras bu smin la /
translated: Thus, the result is ripened in the dream.

original: sad pa'i skabs na gnyid mthug po 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir gsal ba dang ma 'chol bar snang ba nyid kyi 'bras bu lhag pa'o //
analyzed: sad pa'i skabs na gnyid mthug po 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir gsal ba dang ma 'chol bar snang ba nyid kyi 'bras bu lhag pa'o //
translated: But in the waking state, because one is free from the cause of strong error, the dream is clearer and less confused.  Thus, the result is superior.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na'ang las dang 'bras bu yod par 'dod pa'i phyir dge slong ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na'ang las dang 'bras bu yod par 'dod pa'i phyir dge slong ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: And because we accept that karma and its result exist even in the dream state, we do not commit the error of saying that one is not a monk and so on.

original: bslab pa blangs bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis bcas pa'i dbang kho na las sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa gnyis rnam par gzhag par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa blangs bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis bcas pa'i dbang kho na las sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa gnyis rnam par gzhag par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the vows and the non-vows are established only by the power of the Lord's injunctions, even though one has taken the precepts.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du sems can rnams phyin ci log gi las mngon par byed par 'du byed cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du sems can rnams phyin ci log gi las mngon par byed par 'du byed cing /
translated: Therefore, in worldly convention, sentient beings engage in the performance of perverted actions,

original: de las kun nas nyon mongs te //
analyzed: de las kun nas nyon mongs te //
translated: and from that, they are defiled.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But not ultimately.

original: de kho na nyid pa'i phyi rol lam rnam par rig pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang med na gang la gnas nas las byed de /
analyzed: de kho na nyid pa'i phyi rol lam rnam par rig pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang med na gang la gnas nas las byed de /
translated: If there is not the slightest external thing or awareness that is real, then what is it that one abides in and performs actions?

original: dper na rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams kyi bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams kyi bzhin no //
translated: It is like dreams, magical illusions, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi phyin ci log spang ba'i ched du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed de tshogs sogs pa nas ji srid du mngon par byang chub na sems can rnams yongs su grol bar byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi phyin ci log spang ba'i ched du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed de tshogs sogs pa nas ji srid du mngon par byang chub na sems can rnams yongs su grol bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate the error of those who are attached to the existence of the self, the bodhisattva generates the thought of enlightenment, and having generated the thought of enlightenment, he accumulates the collections of merit and knowledge, and when he has attained enlightenment, he liberates sentient beings.

original: 'o na byas shing bsags pa'i las stobs dang ldan pa la ci yongs su sbyong ba yod dam zhe na yod do //
analyzed: 'o na byas shing bsags pa'i las stobs dang ldan pa la ci yongs su sbyong ba yod dam zhe na yod do //
translated: But if karma that is done and accumulated has power, how can it be purified?

original: las rnam pa gnyis te mi dge ba 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: las rnam pa gnyis te mi dge ba 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa khams gsum pa'o //
translated: Karma is of two kinds: nonvirtuous karma that is experienced in the desire realm, and virtuous karma that is experienced in the three realms.

original: de'i stobs ni byed pa po mi 'dod kyang de'i 'bras bu yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni byed pa po mi 'dod kyang de'i 'bras bu yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The power of karma is such that even if the agent does not desire the result, the result is produced.

original: de yongs su sbyong ba ni nus pa med par byed pa ste rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis gang las kyi nus pa skyed par byed pa de dag dang 'gal ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la sbyor ba las de nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su sbyong ba ni nus pa med par byed pa ste rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis gang las kyi nus pa skyed par byed pa de dag dang 'gal ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la sbyor ba las de nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Purification of karma is the nullification of its power. The power of karma is nullified by the application of causes and conditions that are incompatible with the causes and conditions that produce the power of karma.

original: las rnams kyi 'ang kun nas slong ba nyon mongs pa rnams dang dmigs pa ni yul rnams so //
analyzed: las rnams kyi 'ang kun nas slong ba nyon mongs pa rnams dang dmigs pa ni yul rnams so //
translated: The instigators of actions are the afflictions, and their objects are the objects.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'ang rtsa ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'ang rtsa ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The root of the afflictions is incorrect mental activity, which is incorrect conceptualization.

original: de la dngos por 'dzin pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de la dngos por 'dzin pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa ste /
translated: Among those, the apprehension of entities is incorrect conceptualization.

original: dang por de la phyi rol dang nang zhes pa dang brtan pa dang bde ba dang nga'i dang nga'o zhes pa la sogs par sgro 'dogs par bya ba dang las la yon tan mthong ba'o //
analyzed: dang por de la phyi rol dang nang zhes pa dang brtan pa dang bde ba dang nga'i dang nga'o zhes pa la sogs par sgro 'dogs par bya ba dang las la yon tan mthong ba'o //
translated: First, it is the superimposition of external and internal, the stable, the pleasant, mine, and I, and so on, and seeing qualities in karma.

original: de ltar @107b las byed cing byas pa'i las la yongs su dga' ba dang bsngags pa rjes su sgrogs pa la sogs pa mjug rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar @107b las byed cing byas pa'i las la yongs su dga' ba dang bsngags pa rjes su sgrogs pa la sogs pa mjug rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is the completion of the conclusion, which is the performance of karma and delighting in the karma that has been performed and proclaiming its praise, and so on.

original: gang gis te nye bar bsags par yod pa 'bras bu 'byin nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis te nye bar bsags par yod pa 'bras bu 'byin nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: By what? It is the accumulation of karma that becomes able to yield a result.

original: de gcod pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu ste las rnam par sun 'byin pa kun du spyod pas stobs chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gcod pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu ste las rnam par sun 'byin pa kun du spyod pas stobs chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The elimination of that karma is of this sort: it becomes weak through the practice of remorse for one‚Äôs actions.

original: gang gi tshe las de byas na de ma thag kho nar 'gyod pa dang skyon mthong bas sun 'byin par byed pa de'i tshe'i mjug bcom pa nyid kyi phyir stobs chung ba ste kun nas slong mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe las de byas na de ma thag kho nar 'gyod pa dang skyon mthong bas sun 'byin par byed pa de'i tshe'i mjug bcom pa nyid kyi phyir stobs chung ba ste kun nas slong mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one has done that karma, one immediately generates remorse and sees the fault in it, and at that time it is destroyed, because it becomes incapable of producing an effect.

original: sdig pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa ni mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should abandon evil because the wise despise it and because it is not a desirable result.

original: de yang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i mdun du so sor 'chags shing so sor spong ngo de ni bdag gis ma legs pa bgyis pa'o zhes sun 'byin nas slar mi bgyid do zhes dam bcas pas sbyang bar bya ba ste sems kyi chos nyid kyi phyir
analyzed: de yang rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i mdun du so sor 'chags shing so sor spong ngo de ni bdag gis ma legs pa bgyis pa'o zhes sun 'byin nas slar mi bgyid do zhes dam bcas pas sbyang bar bya ba ste sems kyi chos nyid kyi phyir
translated: One should purify it by confessing it individually in the presence of perfect Buddhas and by resolving not to repeat it, thinking, ‚ÄúThat was not good of me.‚Äù

original: ro // khab kyis tsher ma 'don pa bzhin du bsal bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ro // khab kyis tsher ma 'don pa bzhin du bsal bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like a thorn that is removed by a pin.

original: de'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs kun du spyod pas zil gyis mnan pa ni shin tu stobs chung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyen po'i phyogs kun du spyod pas zil gyis mnan pa ni shin tu stobs chung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the power of the antidote is weak when it is overwhelmed by the practice of the side of the passions.

original: gnyen po kun du spyod pa ni mi dge ba'i las dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i yang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i las la shin tu mngon par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen po kun du spyod pa ni mi dge ba'i las dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i yang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i las la shin tu mngon par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The practice of the antidote is the intense application to the uncontaminated action of the wholesome, of the antidote to the unwholesome action and to the contaminated wholesome action.

original: slar ldog pa'i stobs kyis kyang kun nas mnan pas yod kyang cung zad kyang mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar ldog pa'i stobs kyis kyang kun nas mnan pas yod kyang cung zad kyang mi byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also overwhelmed by the power of turning away, so that even if it exists, it does not function at all.

original: so sor ldog pa'i stobs ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa las mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: so sor ldog pa'i stobs ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa las mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'o //
translated: The power of turning away is the obtaining of the vow not to commit an action by taking a vow.

original: sdom pa yang rnam pa lnga ste dge bsnyen nyid la sogs pa so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi sdom pa dang de nyid khyad par dang bcas pa dbang bskur gyi sdom pa dang zag pa dang
analyzed: sdom pa yang rnam pa lnga ste dge bsnyen nyid la sogs pa so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi sdom pa dang de nyid khyad par dang bcas pa dbang bskur gyi sdom pa dang zag pa dang
translated: Vows are also of five types: pratimoksa vows such as those of a layperson, the vows of the three types of ethics generating bodhichitta, the vows of the special empowerment and the vows of the undefiling dharmas.

original: bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / de rnams nyid zag pa dang bral ba zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / de rnams nyid zag pa dang bral ba zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: Vows are also of five types: the pratimoksa vows of the upasaka and so on, the vows of the three types of ethics of generating bodhicitta, the vows of the empowerment that is the special feature of that, the vows of contaminated concentration and the vows of uncontaminated concentration that are free from contamination.

original: de yang dag par len pa ni cho ga ji lta ba bzhin 'dzin pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'o //üîΩsdom pa dang po gsum rnams kyis dran pa'i stobs las mi byed pa'i sdom pa rang bzhin gyis sdig pa'i las mi byed pa'i nges pa thob pa dang bzhi pa las ni kun nas slong ba rnam par gnon par byed pa dang lnga pa las ni kun nas
analyzed: de yang dag par len pa ni cho ga ji lta ba bzhin 'dzin pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'o // sdom pa dang po gsum rnams kyis dran pa'i stobs las mi byed pa'i sdom pa rang bzhin gyis sdig pa'i las mi byed pa'i nges pa thob pa dang bzhi pa las ni kun nas slong ba rnam par gnon par byed pa dang lnga pa las ni kun nas
translated: Correctly taking them is holding them and entering into them according to the rite.

original: slong ba dang @108a * //
analyzed: slong ba dang @108a * //
translated: The first three vows are the attainment of the certainty of not engaging in negative actions by the power of mindfulness. The fourth is the suppression of motivation and the fifth is the suppression of motivation and the suppression of the object.

original: bral ba'o // rten gyi stobs kyis kyang sdig pa las kyi 'jigs pa las bzhin du byed pa po mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pas zil gyis gnon mi nus so //
analyzed: bral ba'o // rten gyi stobs kyis kyang sdig pa las kyi 'jigs pa las bzhin du byed pa po mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pas zil gyis gnon mi nus so //
translated: And by the power of the support, just as one is protected from the fear of evil karma, so one cannot be overcome by the doer who produces the undesirable result.

original: rten gyi stobs ni re zhig dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig nyid de /
analyzed: rten gyi stobs ni re zhig dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig nyid de /
translated: The power of the support is simply going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: ji skad du phag mo'i rtogs pa brjod par sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i bu 'chi ba'i chos can dong gi phag mo'i mngal du skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs pa mthong nas 'jigs skrag pa nas ji srid
analyzed: ji skad du phag mo'i rtogs pa brjod par sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i bu 'chi ba'i chos can dong gi phag mo'i mngal du skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'byin pa la mngon du phyogs pa mthong nas 'jigs skrag pa nas ji srid
translated: As it is said in the Avadana of the Sow, a god of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, subject to death, was born in the womb of a sow in a pigsty. He saw that the result of the karma he was to experience was imminent. He was frightened and terrified.

original: brgya byin gyi ngag las dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song bas las de rtsad nas phyung ste de nas shi 'phos pa dga' ldan du skyes so zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi ngag las dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song bas las de rtsad nas phyung ste de nas shi 'phos pa dga' ldan du skyes so zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Then, hearing the words of Indra, he went for refuge to the Three Jewels. He completely eradicated that karma and then, after death, was reborn in the Joyous Heaven.

original: byang chub kyi sems mi gtong pa yang rten gyi stobs so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems mi gtong pa yang rten gyi stobs so //
translated: And not giving up the Thought of Enlightenment is also the power of the support.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis te smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems kyi dbye ba las so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa gnyis te smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems kyi dbye ba las so //
translated: The thought of awakening is twofold, divided into the thought of aspiration and the thought of engagement.

original: 'jug pa'i sems kyang kun rdzob pa dang don dam pa'i bye brag las rnam pa gnyis so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems kyang kun rdzob pa dang don dam pa'i bye brag las rnam pa gnyis so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The thought of engagement is also twofold, divided into the conventional and the ultimate, as will be explained.

original: de la sman pa'i sems la brtan nas las kyi sgrib pa rtsad nas 'byin pa'i dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la sman pa'i sems la brtan nas las kyi sgrib pa rtsad nas 'byin pa'i dper brjod pa ni /
translated: With regard to that, the example of the thought of aspiration that eradicates the obscurations of karma is as follows:üîΩA son of a friend who wanted to go to another continent was held back by his mother out of love, grabbing his legs. When he got angry, he kicked her in the head and got on the ship.

original: mdza' bo'i bu gling gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod pa mas brtse bas rkang pa dag la 'jus nas bzlog pa nam la khro ba drag pos mgo bo la rkang pa brgyab nas gzings la zhon pa nas ji srid gzings zhig nas rgya mtsho'i 'gro ma na nyi tsheüîΩba'i dmyal ba yod par /
analyzed: mdza' bo'i bu gling gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod pa mas brtse bas rkang pa dag la 'jus nas bzlog pa nam la khro ba drag pos mgo bo la rkang pa brgyab nas gzings la zhon pa nas ji srid gzings zhig nas rgya mtsho'i 'gro ma na nyi tshe ba'i dmyal ba yod par /
translated: As long as the ship was on the ocean, he was in a temporary hell.

original: 'dis ma la ma gus pa byas pa'i las zad pas sdod cig 'khor lo 'di khyod kyi spyi bor bskor bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i sgra bar snang las thos nas /
analyzed: 'dis ma la ma gus pa byas pa'i las zad pas sdod cig 'khor lo 'di khyod kyi spyi bor bskor bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i sgra bar snang las thos nas /
translated: He heard a voice from the sky saying, ‚ÄúSince you have exhausted the karma of disrespecting your mother, stop! This wheel will be placed on your head.‚Äù

original: gang su'ang rung ba 'gro ba 'di na ma la mi gus par byas pa rnams dang byed pa rnams dang byed par 'gyur pa de rnams kyi las de bdag kho na la rnam par smin par gyur cig / su yang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyi
analyzed: gang su'ang rung ba 'gro ba 'di na ma la mi gus par byas pa rnams dang byed pa rnams dang byed par 'gyur pa de rnams kyi las de bdag kho na la rnam par smin par gyur cig / su yang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyi
translated: May no one have a share in this suffering.

original: skal ba can du ma gyur cig ces shugs drag pos smon pa la gnas pa /üîΩ'di 'dra ba'i las mthong ba'i chos la nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de yang yongs su zad de 'khor lo yang de'i sting du de lta nyid du gnas shing slar 'di skad kyang thos te longs la song shig khyod kyi las 'di ni smon pa'i stobs kho
analyzed: skal ba can du ma gyur cig ces shugs drag pos smon pa la gnas pa / 'di 'dra ba'i las mthong ba'i chos la nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de yang yongs su zad de 'khor lo yang de'i sting du de lta nyid du gnas shing slar 'di skad kyang thos te longs la song shig khyod kyi las 'di ni smon pa'i stobs kho
translated: Thus, with intense aspiration, he abides in this.

original: na las ma lus par zad do zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: na las ma lus par zad do zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The karma that would have been experienced in this life is exhausted and the wheel of the lower realms stops. He hears this voice: ‚ÄúRise and go. Your karma is exhausted by the power of aspiration alone.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa'i sems brdar @108b btags pa ni lhag par mos pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems brdar @108b btags pa ni lhag par mos pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs engagement in aspiration is superior.

original: gang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rnams la dang sems can rnams gdod nas dag pa nyid chos rnams rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa nyid du lhag par mos nas byang chub dang sems can la dmigs te sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rnams la dang sems can rnams gdod nas dag pa nyid chos rnams rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa nyid du lhag par mos nas byang chub dang sems can la dmigs te sems skyed par byed do //
translated: One who has faith in the qualities of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas, who has faith in the primordial purity of sentient beings, and who has faith in the selflessness of all things, generates the Thought of Awakening with reference to Awakening and sentient beings.

original: de ltar sems 'di ni dngos por 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin la de'i rtsa ba can gyis chos thams cad kyi gnyen por 'gyur te yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sems 'di ni dngos por 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin la de'i rtsa ba can gyis chos thams cad kyi gnyen por 'gyur te yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, this Thought is the antidote to the grasping of things, and, having that as its root, it becomes the antidote to all things, because it realizes the meaning of reality just as it is.

original: de'i phyir sems bskyed pa 'di ni las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems bskyed pa 'di ni las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, this generation of the Thought purifies all karmic obscurations.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' de gal te snga dro ltung ba byung na nyi ma phyed na byang chub kyi sems mngon du byed pa de'i tshul khrims kyi phung po mtha' med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de gal te snga dro ltung ba byung na nyi ma phyed na byang chub kyi sems mngon du byed pa de'i tshul khrims kyi phung po mtha' med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: If a bodhisattva commits a downfall in the morning, and in the afternoon manifests the Thought of Awakening, his aggregate of morality should be understood to be limitless.

original: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu bskal pa'i me dang mnyam pa'i byang chub kyis sems ni nyes par spyod pa thams cad sreg par byed do zhes rgya cher ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi bu bskal pa'i me dang mnyam pa'i byang chub kyis sems ni nyes par spyod pa thams cad sreg par byed do zhes rgya cher ro //
translated: In the same way, son of noble family, the thought of awakening, which is like the fire at the end of an eon, burns up all misdeeds.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar par rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste sgron me gcig khyim mam gnas khang ci 'dra ba cig tu rab tu bcug na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar par rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste sgron me gcig khyim mam gnas khang ci 'dra ba cig tu rab tu bcug na /
translated: In the same way, in the liberation of the noble Maitreya, it says, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, it is like this: if a single lamp is placed in a house or a room,

original: de rab tu bcug ma thag tu lo stong du bsags pa'i mun pa mun nag kyang sel zhing snang bar byed do //
analyzed: de rab tu bcug ma thag tu lo stong du bsags pa'i mun pa mun nag kyang sel zhing snang bar byed do //
translated: as soon as it is placed there, it dispels the darkness that has accumulated for a thousand years and illuminates it.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa'i sgron me gcig sems can gyi bsam pa'i thibs po ma rig pa'i mun pa dang ldan pa ci 'dra cig tu rab tu zhugs na de rab tu zhugs ma thag tu brjod du med pa'i bskal pa brgya stong
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa'i sgron me gcig sems can gyi bsam pa'i thibs po ma rig pa'i mun pa dang ldan pa ci 'dra cig tu rab tu zhugs na de rab tu zhugs ma thag tu brjod du med pa'i bskal pa brgya stong
translated: In the same way, if a single lamp of the thought of awakening is placed in the darkness of ignorance of the beings‚Äô thoughts, as soon as it is placed there, it dispels the darkness of ignorance that has accumulated for a hundred thousand inexpressibly long eons and illuminates it.‚Äù

original: phrag tu bsags pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i mun pa mun nag kyang sel zhing ye shes kyi snang ba yang dag par bskyed do //
analyzed: phrag tu bsags pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i mun pa mun nag kyang sel zhing ye shes kyi snang ba yang dag par bskyed do //
translated: It also dispels the darkness of the obscurations of karma and afflictions that have been accumulated on the shoulders, and it perfectly generates the light of wisdom.

original: zhes so // 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsebs par yang /
analyzed: zhes so // 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsebs par yang /
translated: In the Sublime Jewel Mound Sutra,

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste phug la sogs par lo brgya stong phrag 'das pa dang skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis til mar sgron me byas na de ci mun pa mun nag de ni lo brgya stong du bsags pa ste 'di nas mi 'gro zhes par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste phug la sogs par lo brgya stong phrag 'das pa dang skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis til mar sgron me byas na de ci mun pa mun nag de ni lo brgya stong du bsags pa ste 'di nas mi 'gro zhes par 'gyur ram /
translated: ‚ÄúKƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this: if a person were to light an oil lamp in a cave or some other place after a hundred or a thousand years have passed, would that darkness that has accumulated for a hundred or a thousand years say, ‚ÄòI will not go away‚Äô?üîΩ‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das ma lags te gang gi phyir til mar sgron me bgyis na de la mi 'gro ba'i nus pa ma mchis te des gdon mi 'tshal ba nyid du 'gro bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma lags te gang gi phyir til mar sgron me bgyis na de la mi 'gro ba'i nus pa ma mchis te des gdon mi 'tshal ba nyid du 'gro bar bgyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, it would not, because if an oil lamp is lit, it has no power to say, ‚ÄòI will not go away,‚Äô and it would have to go away.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni yul rnams te gang gis 'di rnams 'bros pa rnams bzlog pa pos skra nas 'dzin pa bzhin du stobs kyis bkug cing bkug nas btson khang bzhin du bdud kyi yul la 'jog la /

translated: The ultimate root itself is attained by the steadfast, who are not attracted by the objects up to the end of the sphere of controlling others' emanations, and are not overwhelmed by them. As before, the way of summarizing the teaching that actions do not arise is

analyzed: de dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste 'dod pa'i len pa dang lta ba'i len pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi len pa dang bdag gi dngos po'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: It is of four kinds according to the distinctions of its objects: grasping of the objects of desire, grasping of views, grasping of morality and asceticism, and grasping of the doctrine of self.

original: 'dod chags des 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags des 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because of this desire, one grasps the objects of desire, etc.

original: sred pa dang len pa dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between craving and grasping?

original: khyad par med par yang srid la /
analyzed: khyad par med par yang srid la /
translated: There is no difference.

original: @114a * // mngon par dga' ba ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: @114a * // mngon par dga' ba ni sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is the delight in that.

original: khyad par gyis ni len pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyis ni len pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the grasping of that.

original: yang na ring ba'i rgyu sred pa dang nye ba'i rgyu len pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ring ba'i rgyu sred pa dang nye ba'i rgyu len pa'o //
translated: Or else, craving is the remote cause and grasping is the proximate cause.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'du byed kyi sa bon sred pa dang len pas gsos pas 'bras bu bskyed la mngon du phyogs pa ni srid pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'du byed kyi sa bon sred pa dang len pas gsos pas 'bras bu bskyed la mngon du phyogs pa ni srid pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, the seed of the formative forces, watered by craving and grasping, generates the fruit, and is called becoming, which is directed toward the fruit.

original: mdo las ni 'dod pa'i srid pa dang gzugs kyi srid pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las ni 'dod pa'i srid pa dang gzugs kyi srid pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: In the sutra, it is said that there is the becoming of the desire realm, the becoming of the form realm and the becoming of the formless realm.

original: 'on kyang las kyi srid pa kho na la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang las kyi srid pa kho na la dgongs pa'o //
translated: However, it is only the becoming of karma that is intended here.

original: srid pa'i de ma thag tu'ang 'dir rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de skye bar 'gyur te ming dang gzugs la sogs pa rim gyis tshor ba ji srid pa'o ;
analyzed: srid pa'i de ma thag tu'ang 'dir rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de skye bar 'gyur te ming dang gzugs la sogs pa rim gyis tshor ba ji srid pa'o ;
translated: Immediately after becoming, consciousness arises here, which is followed by birth, and so on, up to feeling.

original: / skyes pa'i dga' ba dang 'chi ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / skyes pa'i dga' ba dang 'chi ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The delight in birth and the fear of death, and so on, occur.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas bdag med pa can gyi sdug bsngal gyi tshogs 'di kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas bdag med pa can gyi sdug bsngal gyi tshogs 'di kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the entire collection of suffering, which is devoid of self, originates.

original: de ltar 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni mdor bsdus nas yan lag bzhi rnams su rnam par gzhag par byas so zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni mdor bsdus nas yan lag bzhi rnams su rnam par gzhag par byas so zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the twelve members of dependent origination are presented here in brief as four members.

original: 'di lta ste 'phen byed kyi yan lag dang 'phangs pa'i yan lag dang mngon par 'grub byed kyi yan lag dang mngon par grub pa'i yan lag go zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'phen byed kyi yan lag dang 'phangs pa'i yan lag dang mngon par 'grub byed kyi yan lag dang mngon par grub pa'i yan lag go zhes pa ste /
translated: Namely, the projecting member, the projected member, the actualizing member, and the actualized member.

original: gsum dang bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis so zhes pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin te ;
analyzed: gsum dang bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis so zhes pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin te ;
translated: Three, four, three, and two, respectively.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis po bsdus pa las yan lag bzhi rnams su bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis po bsdus pa las yan lag bzhi rnams su bsgrags pa'o //
translated: The twelve members are declared to be four members, since they are included in these.

original: gang 'di rnams gnas skabs kyi bar la reg pa la ste gang bar skabs kho nar shi ba la ma yin la gzugs dang gzugs med pa la spyod pa la'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang 'di rnams gnas skabs kyi bar la reg pa la ste gang bar skabs kho nar shi ba la ma yin la gzugs dang gzugs med pa la spyod pa la'ang ma yin no //
translated: The members are in the intermediate state, not in the womb or after birth, not in the form and formless realms.

original: de ltar re zhig skye ba gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin du brjod la skye ba gsum du yang rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig skye ba gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin du brjod la skye ba gsum du yang rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Thus, the twelve members are established in two lives.

original: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed 'das pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed 'das pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: Ignorance and formations are the past life.

original: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar ni da ltar gyi skye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar ni da ltar gyi skye ba'o //
translated: Consciousness up to becoming are the present life.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: Birth and old age and death are the future life.

original: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen can gyi 'du byed 'das pa'i skye bar byas pa rnams kyis skye ba 'dir nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa dang por byas nas tshor ba ji srid par rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen can gyi 'du byed 'das pa'i skye bar byas pa rnams kyis skye ba 'dir nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa dang por byas nas tshor ba ji srid par rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub par byed do //
translated: The formations that are conditioned by ignorance and are the past life give rise to the present life, beginning with the first consciousness that links with this life and ending with feeling, and they bring about the actualization of the result.

original: da ltar ba'i srid pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams kyis kyang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la @114b sogs pa bskyed do //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i srid pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams kyis kyang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba la @114b sogs pa bskyed do //
translated: The present life, consisting of craving, grasping, and becoming, gives rise to the future life, beginning with birth.

original: skye ba gsum gyi rnam par gzhag pa 'di'i dgos pa dang sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang bar ma rnams la kun du rmongs pa bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba gsum gyi rnam par gzhag pa 'di'i dgos pa dang sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang bar ma rnams la kun du rmongs pa bzlog pa'o //
translated: The purpose of this presentation of three types of birth is to eliminate confusion about the past, future, and middle.

original: de ltar gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang ma rig pa'i rkyen can gyis 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba bskyed pa'i dus na /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang ma rig pa'i rkyen can gyis 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba bskyed pa'i dus na /
translated: Although this is so, when the birth of formations conditioned by ignorance generates birth,üîΩcraving, grasping, and existence also exist, and they generate future birth.

original: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams kyang yod la de rnams kyis gang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba skyed par byed pa de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rkyen can gyi 'du byed rnams kyis kyang bya ba ste /
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa rnams kyang yod la de rnams kyis gang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba skyed par byed pa de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rkyen can gyi 'du byed rnams kyis kyang bya ba ste /
translated: Similarly, formations conditioned by ignorance also perform their function,

original: ming dang gzugs las gzhan pa'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir de rnams nyid rnam pa gzhan gyis bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs las gzhan pa'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir de rnams nyid rnam pa gzhan gyis bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because birth, etc., other than name and form do not exist, and they are explained in another chapter.

original: de'i phyir skye ba'i rnam par gzhag pa gnyis 'gal ba med do rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum gyi bdag nyid dang lam gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i rnam par gzhag pa gnyis 'gal ba med do rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum gyi bdag nyid dang lam gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: This dependent origination should be known as the nature of the three kinds of thorough affliction and the three paths.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis las dang skye ba 'phen par byed la bden pa mthong ba la las yod kyang yang srid 'phen pa med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas yang srid pa'i sa bon srid par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis las dang skye ba 'phen par byed la bden pa mthong ba la las yod kyang yang srid 'phen pa med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas yang srid pa'i sa bon srid par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, affliction is the thorough affliction, because karma and birth are projected by the power of affliction, because even though karma exists in one who has seen the truth, there is no projection of a new existence, and because the seed of a new existence is made possible by the practice of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang yang srid par nying mtshams sbyar bas 'ching bar byed pa'i phyir skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yang rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang yang srid par nying mtshams sbyar bas 'ching bar byed pa'i phyir skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i yang rgyu mtshan no //
translated: Also, the sign of the thorough affliction of birth is the binding of the afflicted mind by the connection with a new existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dgra bcom pa la nying mtshams sbyor ba med do nyon mongs pa can gyi sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dgra bcom pa la nying mtshams sbyor ba med do nyon mongs pa can gyi sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no rebirth-linking in an arhat, because there is no afflicted mind.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Also, virtuous and nonvirtuous karma are afflicted,

original: de'i tshe nyid na lus dang sems dag ngal ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang phyis kyang rnam par smin pa sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyid na lus dang sems dag ngal ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang phyis kyang rnam par smin pa sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the very cause of the exhaustion of body and mind and because they later yield karmic maturation.

original: skye ba yang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad kyi gzhi rten yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba yang nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad kyi gzhi rten yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Birth is also afflicted because it is the basis and support of all harm.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyang ste /üîΩdang po gnyis ni rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyang ste / dang po gnyis ni rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: There are two types of affliction:üîΩThe first two are the causal afflictions.

original: phyi ma 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o ;
analyzed: phyi ma 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o ;
translated: The latter two are resultant afflictions.

original: / ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: / ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa rnams nyon mongs pa'i lam mo //
translated: Ignorance, craving, and grasping are the path of affliction.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa las kyi lam mo //
translated: Formation and becoming are the path of karma.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams rnam par smin pa'i lam mo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams rnam par smin pa'i lam mo zhes pa'o //
translated: The remaining limbs are the path of karmic maturation.

original: de 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated by the master Nagarjuna:

original: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo rnam gsum pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo rnam gsum pa //
translated: The three cycles of cyclic existence

original: @115a * // thog ma mtha' dang dbus med 'di //
analyzed: @115a * // thog ma mtha' dang dbus med 'di //
translated: Have no beginning, end, or middle,

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du ni //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du ni //
translated: Like the circle of a whirling firebrand

original: phan tshun rgyu mtshan 'khor bar byed //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu mtshan 'khor bar byed //

original: gang gnyen po dang phrad pa na 'bri ba'i chos can de rnams gnyen po'i phyogs shin tu 'phel ba na shin tu 'dzad pa'i chos srid pa yin te gser gyi dri ma la sogs pa bzhin /
analyzed: gang gnyen po dang phrad pa na 'bri ba'i chos can de rnams gnyen po'i phyogs shin tu 'phel ba na shin tu 'dzad pa'i chos srid pa yin te gser gyi dri ma la sogs pa bzhin /
translated: Those phenomena that decrease when they encounter their antidote can also be phenomena that completely cease when the antidote increases greatly, just as the stains of gold and so on can be completely removed.

original: 'khor ba pa yang bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnyen po'i phyogs la mngon du phyogs pa yod na 'bri ba'i chos can yin no zhes pa'i tshad ma las 'khor ba'i rgyun chad pa yod do //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa yang bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnyen po'i phyogs la mngon du phyogs pa yod na 'bri ba'i chos can yin no zhes pa'i tshad ma las 'khor ba'i rgyun chad pa yod do //
translated: If the continuum of cyclic existence also has the quality of decreasing when it encounters the antidote, which is the truth of the path characterized by selflessness and so on, then it is possible for the continuum of cyclic existence to be severed.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad sangs rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad sangs rgyas 'gyur //
translated: All these beings will become buddhas.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i lung las kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i lung las kyang ngo //
translated: This is also stated in the scriptures.üîΩAs YuktisÔ¨ÅasÔ¨ÅÔ¨ÅtikaÃÑüîΩsays,

analyzed: ji skad du rigs pa drug cu par gsungs pa /
translated: Because the perfect Buddha said

analyzed: ma rig rkyen gyis 'jig rten zhes // gang phyir rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gsungs // de phyir 'jig rten 'di dag ni //
translated: That the world is conditioned by ignorance,üîΩWhy is it not tenable to say

original: rnam par rtog par cis mi 'thad //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par cis mi 'thad //

original: ma rig 'gags par gyur pa na //
analyzed: ma rig 'gags par gyur pa na //

original: gang gi 'gog pa skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gi 'gog pa skye 'gyur ba //
translated: And the arising of its cessation.

original: de phyir mi shes kun brtags par //
analyzed: de phyir mi shes kun brtags par //
translated: Therefore, the ignorant imagine it.

original: ci yi phyir ni gsal mi 'gyur //üîΩgnas med dmigs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: ci yi phyir ni gsal mi 'gyur // gnas med dmigs pa yod ma yin //
translated: Why then does it not become clear?üîΩThere is no basis, there is no object.

original: rtsa ba med cing gnas pa med //
analyzed: rtsa ba med cing gnas pa med //
translated: It is rootless, it is groundless.

original: ma rig sa bon las byung ba //
analyzed: ma rig sa bon las byung ba //
translated: It arises from the seed of ignorance.

original: thog ma dbus mtha' rnam par spangs //
analyzed: thog ma dbus mtha' rnam par spangs //
translated: It is free from beginning, middle, and end.

original: chu shing dbus bzhin snying po med //
analyzed: chu shing dbus bzhin snying po med //
translated: It is without essence, like the core of the plantain tree.

original: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu ste //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer lta bu ste //

original: kun rmongs grong khyer 'jigs rung ba //
analyzed: kun rmongs grong khyer 'jigs rung ba //

analyzed: gang zhig bden par rab brjod pa //
translated: that this world is real.

original: de yang 'phags rnams brdzun zhes gsungs //

analyzed: chags sdang drag po 'byung 'gyur ba'i // lta ba ma rungs yongs su 'dzin //
translated: intense attachment and hostility arise.üîΩAnd you will engage in disputes

original: de yis bslangs pa'i rtsod pa byed //
analyzed: de yis bslangs pa'i rtsod pa byed //
translated: that are motivated by those.

original: @115b de ni lta ba kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: @115b de ni lta ba kun gyi rgyu //

analyzed: de med nyon mongs 'byung mi 'gyur //

original: de phyir de ni yongs shes na //
analyzed: de phyir de ni yongs shes na //

original: cis de yongs shes 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: cis de yongs shes 'gyur zhe na //
translated: How is it fully understood?

original: rten cing 'brel par mthong ba las //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par mthong ba las //

analyzed: brten nas skyes pa ma skyes par // de nyid rig pa'i mchog gis gsungs //
translated: that what arises dependently does not arise.

original: log pa'i shes pas zil mnan pa //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pas zil mnan pa //
translated: Those who are overcome by wrong knowledge,
